Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel with excellent, flawless service. Bed is possibly the most comfortable i have experienced. Go.”
Reviews.Author: Jamesdotkelly
Reviews.Content: A lovely experience as ever. Never disappointed by the Four Seasons. I received a complimentary upgrade which was a nice surprise, but throughout my stay the staff could not have been better. The property is flawless and beautiful and downtown location make this a must visit. Completely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Staff, Staff, Staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DBLMillionMiler
Reviews.Content: As I pulled up, immediately they had my bags out and ready to go. I went to the check-in counter and before I could get out my entire name did he say "we've been expecting you Mr. Laursen". They upgraded my room to a lake view....worth every penny. When I would walk through the hotel, I was always being asked if everything was taken care of, they remembered my name, the housekeeping staff made sure the mini bar was stocked with what I wanted, when I first arrived at my room, the bellman asked if I needed anything pressed, which I did, and he had it back to me later that night. The name Four Seasons already evokes a high quality property but the staff made me want to come back again and again. I go to Chicago 5-6 times a year and will be staying at the Four Seasons from now on Thank you to everyone for a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable weekend”
Reviews.Author: Tom F
Reviews.Content: Perfect location and accommodations for a stay in Chicago. Quite location in the heart of the Gold Coast. Room, staff, and total experience are top drawer and worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Sunday Brunch stinks”
Reviews.Author: Enrique A
Reviews.Content: This is the worst sunday Brunch we have ever experienced. Unkind, slow, poor portions, no buffet and dirty tables. If you stay there better try the corner bakery cafe tuna sandwich, there is where we finished today.

Reviews.Title: “Executive Suite.. Awesome”
Reviews.Author: kadie c
Reviews.Content: We went into Chicago for a short weekend trip, and we loved it! Our executive suite was beautiful. I loved the new lobby... it was much more modern and up to date. The service was amazing and the food was delicious :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!!!...I stay here every so often, and it's always a pleasure!!”
Reviews.Author: nancy s
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay at the Four Seasons Chicago...The location of this Hotel is perfect it's located near shopping ,great restaurants......You pretty much can walk everywhere from this hotel.. The rooms are spotless and beautiful,they have the best blueberry pancakes i have ever had.. The bar is always fun to get a cocktail, coffee, or some great food..Love,love,love this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Classic!”
Reviews.Author: DDCee
Reviews.Content: The location is ideal for shopping the Magnificent Mile. This is an older hotel in comparison to Trump or the Peninsula, but it is always a safe bet as far as service and everything the Four Seasons has to offer. The decor is warm, with a lot of wood, and with european charm. Service is first class as would be expected.

Reviews.Title: “You will never be dissapointed.......best location, service and ambiance.”
Reviews.Author: Misonix
Reviews.Content: best location, best service. had my kids come up and brought some friends, went to Gibsons and shopped at Bloomingdales all within steps.............went to the pool at night, (you have to see it!) cookies and milk for the kids in the room! what a view from all rooms!

Reviews.Title: “First time at a Four Seasons. I want to stay at Four Seasons all the time if they are like thisâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: Around_the_World_165
Reviews.Content: Very Grand and luxurious; fresh flowers everywhere. The lobby wow's and you will be continued to be wowed when you arrive at your room or should I say suite. We were in a normal room, but when you stepped inside, we were greeted with a huge suite like room - a hall way, a HUGE bathroom with a fabulous bath and oh L'occitan smellies everywhere. The main room - the bedroom was very pleasant. It was spacious with so much storage available (not that we needed that), huge TV, a desk and lounge chair. We had a view of Lake Michigan which was an added bonus. And use the Spaâ€¦it's fantastic. A great way to relax after a day of exploring Chicago! The hotel is in a great location; easy access to all parts of Chicago. I hope we can stay again sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons in Heaven - I mean Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: gjborca
Reviews.Content: This is my third review of the same property - Four Seasons in Chicago. I would typically not review the same property - but you don't care about my tendencies. I choose to chime in when I see a review other than exceptional. This place is amazing. The recent renovations "sex up" the classy conservative interior with splashes of modern artwork and color. The location is the best in Chicago; the rooms are awesome; the staff is the standard-bearer for luxury hotels and the new renovations make the place "edgy." It's not inexpensive - but the value is worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Our first stay at a 4 Seasons - everything was first rate. Room was comfortable, very clean. Staff was exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: Debbi_G37535
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight for a family wedding held at the hotel. When we checked in we were acknowledged as guests for the wedding and asked if we had a pleasant trip in from our home state. Our room (40th floor) was lovely(very clean) with great views of the city and lake. Loved the bathroom (like a mini spa complete with a his/hers plush robe). Everyone was extremely helpful and pleasant - as if they couldn't do enough for us!! The location was good, but as we were in only for the night, didn't get to take advantage of all the sites/activities outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views and Location”
Reviews.Author: compgal
Reviews.Content: I walked in and checked in for a business trip and experienced amazing service. The person at the front desk asked how my day had been so far and gave me a tour of the lobby, how to get to the mall and also to the rooms. The staff was really welcoming. The cleaning staff greeted me with a smile when as I was getting onto the elevator. A much different experience than some hotels we have stayed at. The room was amazing. A fantastic room with unparalleled views. What a great experience to awaken to an unbelievable sunrise over Lake Michigan. The window seat was a plus also as I sat there and did some work during the evening overlooking the city. The proximity to Rush Street and all of the amenities it offers is great too. Loved that they gave a coupon to the stores at the 900 mall.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Jinx223
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is good except the service really when you are someone that has alot of money and does not get paid attention too or even welcomed when you arrive at the hotel. The staff at the hotel are rude to you thats just not acceptable when i go there about 2 - 3 times a year i dont expect to be treated like crap by someone. I would not reccomend this hotel and i might not be even going back when i could go to the Peninsula or Ritz Carlton and be treated better.

Reviews.Title: “They ruined brunch.”
Reviews.Author: Dtannenbaum1
Reviews.Content: We just spent the weekend at the Chicago Four Seasons. As alwaysvservice was superb. They have unfortunately ruined the best Sunday brunch. My wife and I have tried Sunday brunches everywhere we have travelled. Even when we come across a good one, even a really good one, we normally conclude that regardless of how good brunch was it wasn't as good as the Chicago Four Seasons. No more. It is now totally different and nowhere near as good. The end of a Subday brunch era. Too bad.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay excellent service great location”
Reviews.Author: illdds
Reviews.Content: stayed here with several employees for a retreat in february 2012. We had a one bedroom suite which served perfectly for our breakfast meetings. Spa services and pool area were an excellent experience. Highly recommend staying here when looking for a luxury hotel in chicago for business or pleasure

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: Dave J
Reviews.Content: Staff goes out of their way to make you feel welcome, amenities galore.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Pamela D
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Chicago four seasons, and it was wonderful!! The newely renovated hotel is absolutely stunning. Our hotel room had a wonderful view of the city, and was very clean. The location was awesome too. We also enjoyed room service, and breakfast in the restaurant, and both were delicious. Staff was professional and attentive. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great to be back”
Reviews.Author: kkeesee
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite hotels & it was great to be back. As with all of the Four Seasons properties, the service is exceptional both in professionalism & politeness, but here it comes with a hearty smile & a welcome back. My wife loves the l'occitaine products & my kids love the cookes & milk at bedtime. I read many comments on the creaky in the building and it is true. Having worked in the building years ago, I can remember seeing the water in the toilets slashing when the winds really kick. It can be off putting if you are not use to it, but the hotel does provide ear plugs, use them. The staff always goes above & beyond & it was great to be back.

Reviews.Title: “No Room for Improvement”
Reviews.Author: Exline
Reviews.Content: The location, service, room were all 100% incredible. There simply was no flaw to be found at this hotel. The views of Lake Michigan were breathtaking, and the rooms are adequate size.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECTION”
Reviews.Author: Rob S
Reviews.Content: The staff was very professional, friendly and extremely accommodating. The service and attention is unparalleled. All meeting functions were handled beyond expectations. The entire staff paid attention to every detail and handled all requests as though I were the only person in the hotel. The food is phenomenally creative and delicious. Since completion of their renovations, the atmosphere is luxurious and comforting and the spa is absolutely exquisite. P.S. - If you not only LOVE a strong shower but DEMAND it, look no further. This is your place. :-) I wish I could say the same for the Ritz-Carlton............exact opposite.......sorry.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: kcullop
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful, convenient and great staff who consistently checked with us, and concierge services were outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay with Kids”
Reviews.Author: good j
Reviews.Content: Although I am a Chicago resident, I stayed at the Four Season for a girls night with my sister, three year old daughter and two neices (5 and 7). While I have stayed at other Four Seasons properties and also other luxury hotels, the Four Seasons Chicago went above and beyond my expectations. Besides their typical impeccable service, they were more than accomodating to our three children. They provided us with snacks, games, children's (organic!) shampoo and soap and even had three small robes and a step stool. Their in-room dining menu also catered to children and was very reasonably priced (for a luxury hotel). Also, I forgot an overnight diaper for my three year old and I called down to the front desk and they immediatley brought up 5 diapers! Everyone was so helpful (from the front desk to Anne Marie in sales who helped me get my room)-- I want to stay there every weekend! I will ALWAYS stay at the Four Seasons Chicago when I need another staycation.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel in the Four Seasons collections”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary-NY
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Chicago is past its prime. While the service meets the traditionally high Four Seasons standards -- and that goes a long way in enhancing the guest experience -- the lobby is shabby, the dining room is dull and poorly lighted and the rooms are sub-standard (yet expensive). In fairness, they are renovating the lobby but I was there days before the unveiling and it wasn't much changed; better lighting would go a long way toward improving the moment. The lobby is on the 7th floor, which renders it less than welcoming from the start; decor should be used to overcome that disorienting entrance, not make it worse. Although I found the guest room quiet, the hotel supplies ear plugs to protect against (the text explains), the sound of the wind off the lake! The restaurant offering isn't exotic but it's well done, and the wait staff is attentive in a manner that is polite yet coolly reserved. But for its location close to great shopping and the lake, there wouldn't be a good reason to choose this hotel over others if you were choosing it for any reason other than a night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in the city”
Reviews.Author: Matt W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a weekend getaway (for her birthday). It is close to all the shops down Michigan Ave (including Water Tower). The service is outstanding and the room was incredible. I can't forget to mention the view! WOW! This might become a yearly birthday tradition!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely get away”
Reviews.Author: cubs312
Reviews.Content: We stayed one evening for a family get away. The room was beautiful and the bedding was very comfortable. Our view of Lake Michigan was breathtaking!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've stayed in !”
Reviews.Author: barberj81
Reviews.Content: There were absolutely no bad comments I can say about this hotel. Every single staff member from the car valet to the concierge were welcoming, respectful, accommodating and considerate of our needs! They offered to allow us to check in early and they offer complementary parking until 3pm the next day to allow you to explore the city. The rooms were clean, organized and had almost every amenity you could ask for including ear plugs to drown out the wind. It was fabulous and I would highly recommend this hotel. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST CHOICE IN CHICAGO FOR BUSINESS OR FAMILY”
Reviews.Author: Bill H
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in pretty much every good hotel in Chicago. The Four is the BEST. The staff is incredible. They truly care and go out of their way to make sure my family and I are happy. When I pulled up to the hotel the prompt and friendly doorman had the keys to my room waiting (ask for this when making your reservation) and I was whisked directly to my palatial room. The rooms are exceptional and very luxurious and the beds are like sleeping on a cloud. Very high thread count sheets are smooth and silky. The view of lake Michigan and the city are inspiring. Little details that other hotels don't think of are in the rooms. My wife loves the special L'Occitaine shampoo and conditioner and free slippers! I enjoy the free use of the business center and having a huge umbrella in the closet for a rainy day. And by the way, the spa, pool and workout area are first class. The food is fantastic too. Best pancakes in town and a daily special for dinner that is inspired! This is the number one hotel in Chicago, hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff & rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: Brooke C
Reviews.Content: My husband, 14 mos. daughter and I stayed in Chicago for 5 nights, and when we originally booked another hotel, after 2 nights, we switched to the Four Seasons and were definitely NOT DISAPPOINTED! I love everything about this hotel! The staff are AMAZING! They are the best! The spa is amazing and I love the swimming area. They cater to all your needs, go out of their way to make it an amazing stay. They greeted us with such kindness and since we are from WI they gave us an amazing surprise when we first arrived with a cow-themed cookies and milk tray. They laid out a crib with diapers and lotions for my daughter and even baby shampoo for her in the bath tub. They did everything up to par and I have nothing to complain about. The location is great and I can't stop mentioning about amazing the staff is! They will make you feel like family! Thank you Four Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: poodia
Reviews.Content: We checked in Christmas Day with our 11 year old son and stayed 4 nights. We had a 2 room corner suite on the 32nd floor. A view of the lake from the bedroom window and a view of Michigan Avenue from the living room. The Christmas Buffet was absolutely unbelievable. We were seated at 6:30 which is their last seating on Christmas Day. There were not just tables and tables of gorgeous delicious food, there were whole different rooms of food categories. Everything you can imagine was served from traditional turkey and dressing, filet of beef, roast duck, ham, dressings and gratins to sushi, crab legs, enormous shrimp, endless salads and vegetables. I'm a dessert girl, and I was not disappointed. From the moment we exited our cab from O'Hare, the 5 star rating was evident and deserved. From the doormen, to the maids, to the concierge and front desk, everyone knew us by name. We did some post-Christmas shopping in the lovely 900 Michigan Mall attached to the hotel. We rested tired feet in the hotel's lobby bar, which is all dark woods and English library decor. The bar staff were excellent, both prompt and unobtrusive. My only complaint was at breakfast. On our last day, we were seated at a table near a man dining alone. He talked loudly on his cell phone throughout our meal. It was the manager's responsibility to enforce the no cell phone rule in the dining room and that never happened. In general, breakfast service was slow all 4 days we were there, less friendly and just not quite up to the standards of the rest of the staff. I reported the cell phone complaint to the hostess who received my complaint graciously and I am certain she reported it to the manager. We just had a ball. We hosted friends and family. We shopped and visited the Shedd Aquarium. We had a fabulous dinner at Tru and a really lovely lunch at the Ralph Lauren restaurant. We ate Chicago pizza at Gino's east and a sundae at Ghiradelli's. I just love Chicago and hope I will always be fortunate enough to stay at the 4S.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as usual !”
Reviews.Author: Sergio228
Reviews.Content: Excellent Stay ! Given the location and the quality of the Service !

Reviews.Title: “Can't give it 5 stars!”
Reviews.Author: JDAMWFB
Reviews.Content: 5 Stars for a Four Seasons should be a lay up. This one missed the bucket. The player (to continue with the metaphor) was just a tad bit too old and not quite what it should have been from the dusty room to the too small work out facility for a 5 star property. Still a very nice hotel, and certainly better than most hotels, but it's not what a Four Seasons should be. The only thing consistent with the out the world experience of other Four Seasons was their pricing model.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: NewPal_TravelFamily
Reviews.Content: We went to the Four Season Labor Day weekend 2010 and absolutely loved it. The staff was great, the room was spacious and great. They had games and cookies and milk for the kids. It was very clean. We will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, staff and service.”
Reviews.Author: Larrybry
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, location, staff and service. 4 Seasons quality with Chicago heart. I have stayed at most of Chicago's large luxury hotels and the Four Seasons has trumped them. If you have not been to the hotel in a while, come back. It is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “I always enjoy my stay!”
Reviews.Author: Elsa3
Reviews.Content: This is my third time staying at the Four Seasons Chicago. The rooms are beautiful and the staff is extremely friendly. It is a great location for shopping. I have stayed in a variety of rooms from the deluxe to the suites, and every stay is perfect. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to the four seasons staff chicago”
Reviews.Author: sandra m
Reviews.Content: Kudos to the staff at the Four Seasons Chicago they made our stay exceptional!! We stayed Dec 16th and 17th. From the moment of entry the staff were welcoming and one step ahead of our every need. Our suite was great tx to megan at checkin. Our dining experience was outstanding tx to our server Russell and the dining room host megan. The followup and attentiveness by mgrs Nick and Steve only added to our recognition of a world class operation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Away”
Reviews.Author: perufor40th
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent Veteran's day weekend in Chicago without our kids - this only happens once or twice a year if we are lucky, so it is a big deal for us. We had a lovely weekend at the Four Seasons - the room was great, the pool/spa was great and the location was ideal. However, best of all, was the service. I spoke to the concierge on the phone a couple weeks before our trip - Heather - and asked about restaurants in the area. She suggested a few - Avec (which was great) & Le Colonial (where we had an amazing 4 course lunch) - and asked if we needed reservations because of a special event. I said it was indeed our anniversary the next week, but really the long weekend was just a chance to get away for 3 nights. Anyway, there was a bottle of champagne in our room along with chocolate-dipped strawberries and a note from the manager thanking us for spending our anniversary with them in Chicago. All that from a simple off handed comment made a couple of weeks before we got there. That is great service and I thank you Heather! We will return!

Reviews.Title: “No better place for a party”
Reviews.Author: Urbane_Hoosier
Reviews.Content: My (then) employer chose this hotel for its 100th year anniversary, where it invited its key leaders. The service from the valet parking to the dinner service was outstanding. It made the evening more fun and meaningful than it already had promised to be. I have stayed in the Four Seasons in Houston, TX a couple of times as well and the service there was exemplary as well. This "chain" (only a few in the world really) has service and excellence in quality as its top priority and it executes extremely well. I hope other travelers will have similar experiences and push this hotel into Chicago's top 5, where it belongs.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a dream experience”
Reviews.Author: Cindy B
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Four Seasons Chicago and I can't say enough about the entire experience. What a treat this was for me - I will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Just what a hotel was meant to be...”
Reviews.Author: LelaM
Reviews.Content: From top to bottom, this was a flawless experience. They dealt with the bags American Airlines had lost, without my asking (and had them delivered to my room without my having to chase AA by the next morning), the room service is exceptionally delicious and punctual, the cleaning immaculate, the early morning personal wake up call by a human being and a cup of coffee at the front desk for early departures most appreciated, as was the free access to internet and the spa/gym facilities - no hassle hotelier of the year. I'll not even start on the quality of the bed, linens, etc....bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Favorite”
Reviews.Author: Bella P
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Four Seasons Chicago many times. The location is great and you can walk to almost everything. There is a shopping center attached just an elevator ride away which is great if you do not want to venture outside. The Spa and pool area is beautiful. When checking in you do have to take an elevator from the street level up. The suites are beautiful and the views of the lake truly magnificent. If it is windy be prepared to hear lots of creaking, but from what I understand it is normal. Bar area is a great place to grab a drink before or after dinner and the small bites are good. Concierge very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: Bus_Travel_TX
Reviews.Content: We moved to the Four Season's this weekend, after leaving a another downtown hotel where we had planned to stay (it was disappointing, but that's another review.) The Four Season's is like an island of peace in the middle of the city. From the doormen, to the front desk staff, to the concierge to the housekeeper, everything was so nice, as if we were a guest in their home. The property is very beautiful. Like most four seasons, the lobby is calming with a lot of natural stone, chrystal chandeliers, wood trim and thick carpet. We had a standard room, which was on the 39th floor, looking over the shore of the lake. The room was spotlessly clean, everything was in perfect working order and overall it was so nice and peaceful that we almost forgot to go out front ot hit the streets for Christmas shopping. We enjoyed breakfast in the restaurant on Saturday morning, and again, it we calm and peaceful. Not much more to say other that it was a perfect weekend get away. Yes, the hotel was slightly more expensive that the oprion across the street, but it was worth every penny. I am sure that my company will not let me stay here on business (rates are a little more than our Corporate accoutn will bear) but when I visit for personal reasons again, this is my first choice! About the only downside that I can comment on is the swaying and creaking at night. The rooms are high in a building that is very close to the shore. It does sway and you do hear noises at night. It was not unbearable, but a minor distraction. At least they did tell us about it, with a printed card that explained the noise .. with ear plugs ... on the night table.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Comfort and Overwhelmingly Friendly”
Reviews.Author: djkeys
Reviews.Content: Was lucky enough to have business meeting at Four Seasons and spent a week including TGiving. What stands out the most is the overwhelming friendliness of the staff, from the bartender to the bellman on the street. All made it their job for you to be happy and welcomed. Concierge Heather was a special treat as every, and I mean every, recommendation she made was on the money. We explained what we liked in restaurants etc. and she came through with great recommendations, not necessarily on the top lists, which was even more unique and fun. Although I use Trip Advisor heavily when traveling, Heather was much better. Debated upgrading to suite but we were so comfortable in our deluxe room that we decided to save the upgrade costs spend more on other fun things, food and the world class shopping all within blocks of the outstanding location. One of the best hotel gyms we have ever used. Meeting accommodations superb. Was there a downside? Yes but only three things. No coffee in room or on floor. I can get coffee in my room at the Hampton Inn, but not the Four Seasons!!! I just do not understand the logic on that one. And the wireless internet is way too slow for what you would expect from the FS - better at Starbucks. One evening there was an unexplained power failure, affecting most rooms for several hours - our room was black. Very creepy. Although apologies were made at checkout, I feel that this could have been handled much smoother by such a fine hotel. A nice apology letter under everyones door or maybe even e.g. free muffins or croissants in the lobby the next AM, would have been an outstanding touch. It was like it was swept under the rug. These issues certainly stood out, because everything else was so fantastic. In the overall picture the few negatives were not huge and we remain overwhelmed with our experience and look forward to coming back. Everything cannot be perfect for a full week stay, even the Four Seasons is in the real world - although when you enter the hotel it is a bit of a fantasy land. Overall one of our top hotel experiences ever. And we even bought a Four Seasons bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Christmas/convention destination”
Reviews.Author: paul b
Reviews.Content: Rooms are on the 32nd floor and up making for great views of the city or the lake. They are spacious and comfortable. Meeting areas are also excellent. Food is quite pricey but all good restaurants around the "mile" are great and high end of reasonable. Decor, staff and location make this a great property from which to shop or conduct business.

Reviews.Title: “Top place to stay in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: tim_twr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Four Seasons Hotel in Chicago, and recommend it whole-heartedly. We have stayed in some very grand and luxurious hotels, but this has become our standard to beat. The service was remarkably good throughout, without being oppressive The concierge was particularly friendly and extraordinarily helpful. She booked us tickets for the canal architectural tour, which we would otherwise have missed, since we did not realise how quickly it became booked up. When we asked where was the nearest Catholic church she had walking directions already printed out. They lent us umbrellas. They knew the answer to all our questions. The breakfast was excellent. The standard of decoration and flowers etc. was very high but not at the expense of complete comfort. (We recently stayed in a self-consciously beautiful hotel in Vienna where there was no common sense and the badly designed shower flooded the bathroom floor.) The bedroom's view over Chicago from so high up was good fun. In short, we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Synthizen
Reviews.Content: Service was pretty good and everyone was friendly, but that's about the only really good thing I can say about this one. I stayed on fourtieth floor. Very windy up that high, but you'd think they would have taken that into account when building out the rooms, you know, with it being The Windy City and all, but no. As the wind blew, and the building flexed, the room creaked continuously all night, and through my entire stay ... I counted, average of about 4 creaks a minute, loud enough to be very noticeable. Add to that the shower/bath is poorly designed, and water literally floods onto the floor no matter how tightly you close the shower doors. The complimentary WiFi was way too slow, to the point that web pages that normally take a few seconds to load, took minutes. Had breakfast in the hotel restaurant, Belgian Waffle, and it was dry and oversalted (or something -- it just didn't taste very good). So, all-in-all, a pretty big dissapointment and certainly tarnishes the brand in my mind. My room was 560 dollars a night, and I've had better experiences at hotels at half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Love again”
Reviews.Author: shoprdoc
Reviews.Content: We had a return trip to the Four Seasons which was every bit as memorable as our first.... We booked through Ivonne@lorrainetravel.com who has been great to work with and has set up memorable surprises including chocolate milk and cow cookies. Everyone from the man who greeted us at the curb and recognized our children (or at least made them feel he did) to Juliet in the lounge area where we enjoyed several dinners could not have made our children and family feel more special. The location is great. We walked to the Water Tower Theater and saw Pinkalicious. We buzzed in a quick cab down to the Art Institute, Shedd and Field Museum. Our room was a gorgeous corner suite with an unbelievable night view. The Four Seasons Chicago is one of our favorite hotels in the world. We cant wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great room”
Reviews.Author: MAtraveler13
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an executive suite with our 10 year old and 12 year old for a long weekend. The bedroom had a lot of space and great views of the city and the lake. The bed was unbelievably comfortable. The living area is a little small but well designed. It would be helpful to have a few more drawers and to have a double sink in the bathroom. The kids were thrilled when they brought popcorn and soda for them after we checked in and cupcakes for them the second day we were there. The pool is nice- big with lots of chairs and some windows so it didn't have that basement feel.

Reviews.Title: “Not blown away”
Reviews.Author: ccmo
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the last two reviews. We have stayed in Four Seasons properties before and have come to expect great things. While we did not have a bad experience, we did not have the experience we have had in other properties. The check-in was friendly but robotic. We chose to carry our bags in as the bellman could not predict when we would otherwise get our bags. No offer again of helping with bags once we were inside. The room was nice (executive suite) but our suite at the Talbot Hotel was definitely larger. We received no newspaper on Thanksgiving but noticed other rooms around us had. We had to ask twice for items both at the bar and during our meal at the Bistro. Nothing earthshattering, just not what you would normally expect from a Four Seasons. We loved the location and the quietness of the building and our room. Just not sure we would return as there are so many other nice properties to choose from in Chicago. We just did not feel the value was there for how much we paid for our room.

Reviews.Title: “Under but definitely not overwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: candeux
Reviews.Content: On our first visit to Chicago as a couple, we decided to treat ourselves to the Four Seasons to celebrate our anniversary. We were eagerly anticipating our visit to the city and the hotel. The city did not disappoint. And we'll return to Chicago. However, we will not return to the FS there. It's not that anything horrible happened nor that the hotel was physically off-putting nor the staff rude. After all, it is a FS and they do have standards to uphold. We were just UNDERwhelmed when we were expecting to be OVERwhelmed. Perhaps we have been spoiled too much by other luxury hotel brands We don't stay in this calibre of hotel for business but choose to do so for personal use only. Would hate to mix business with pleasure. But little touches we have come to anticipate were missing from our stay. What, no chocolates on the pillows to accompany the turn-down service? No mouthwash? No anniversary wishes when, upon reservation, one is asked if a special occasion is being celebrated? The staff were pleasant enough but not tripping over themselves to assist you. And as friendly and helpful as the concierge ladies were, they made no attempt to address you by name, much less remember your name even though you used their services more than once on a four-day trip. The best part of our hotel stay was the beautiful corner room (to which we were upgraded for a fee) with a great bed and fantastic views of the Lake and the Mile. If we didn't have that at least, this review would have been less than average. There's no half or 3/4 button but we would give 3 1/2 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: ParisKat
Reviews.Content: We have always loved the Four Seasons Chicago, but it had been far too long since our last visit. Since then, the rooms have been redecorated (lovely), but the service is just as perfect as always. Somehow, the Four Seasons strikes a perfect balance of professionalism and luxury, without a bit of pretension. We always breathe a sigh of relief when we enter their beautiful lobby. The rooms are very comfortable. We had a corner suite with both city and lake views. It was absolutely quiet, except for the noise of the building swaying (normal). The bed is fantastic! I wish my own bed was that comfortable. The bathroom has robes and slippers, and L'Occitane bath products. Great water pressure in the shower. The bar is my favorite bar in the world: leather chairs, quiet, serious bartenders. As other posters have said, the location is great. For the first time, we used the indoor pool facilities. Pool, jacuzzi, steam rooms, and saunas. Very nice, with plenty of towels and bottled water.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay with nice people”
Reviews.Author: justjoe2
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the weekend of the Chicago Marathon. The staff still made time to be kind and helpful. They helped us get into restaurants in town and with directions. The hotel is very centrally located to everything from Michigan Ave to the lake to Carmine's. All within a walk. About a 10 minute cab ride from the Amtrak station. Free wifi and comfortable rooms. Old style charm.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the city”
Reviews.Author: BCparent
Reviews.Content: For my purposes, this location cannot be beat: step out the door and immerse yourself in the city. This is the best starting point for a shopping weekend (in particular). The hotel does not veer from the typical Four Seasons experience: pristine, little extras (during the holidays they have coffee and hot chocolate in the lobby all day), elegant rooms etc... We have had brunch on every visit (Sundays) and it is really something. Reservations are necessary (for any weekend meal in the hotel based on past experience). It's the consistency and the location that bring us back here when we're in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Shiley
Reviews.Content: We spent our anniversary here and had a perfect visit. Our suite was spectacular and we had lake and city views. They thought of everything to make our anniversary special, A total homerun.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous Family-Friendly Awesomeness”
Reviews.Author: gjborca
Reviews.Content: I have previously reviewed this Four Seasons property in March of 2011 where it set the standard that all hotels we've ever visited. We came back for in November when our kids had a four day weekend. This property continues to hit the mark. The facility is exceptional and the staff superb. The location at 900 N. Michigan is one of the best in town - Oak Street two blocks to the North and all of Michigan to the South. While this is a serious property for discerning travelers, their attentiveness to details around family visits cannot be understated. They aren't making compromises for families, they obviously have a plan around attracting and keeping family visitors. Sure, it's a bit pricey, but the value and experience make it more than worth the extra money as far as our family goes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ty C
Reviews.Content: Had a fabulous room they remembered me from last year and I think upgraded me as a repeat customer or I just lucked out. My bag was lost by the air line and the hotel completely covered getting it up to my room when it arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful common areas, great location, average rooms, good service”
Reviews.Author: SaraMB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons in Chicago for a long weekend. The location is terrific and teh common areas quite nice. However, the rooms were a bit more spartan than I expected from a Four Seasons, and especially for the high price. The decoration in the rooms was very white, lucite lamps on the night stands, bathrooms pretty basic amenities, not very lush or pampering at all. Service at the hotel was top notch, though, and room service arrived quickly. The views are also spectacular. Overall very good experience, but a bit under my usual expectation of Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deven T
Reviews.Content: I spent my 3 night Birthday weekend here in a 1 bedroom suite I highly recommend this Four Seasons hotel. Beautiful 5 star hotel. The Decor in both the hotel & lovely well maintained indoor pool & spa were exceptional The location is perfect its close to Rush St where there are many great restaurants & bars, it's also close to the Navy Pier & Shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great restaurant and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Outofdodge_10
Reviews.Content: When I stayed at The Four Seasons, the staff took care of everything for me. They were aware, but not intrusive. It was pleasant and I particularly liked their breakfast. I also appreciate their policy with celebrities. They are cordial and are non-intrusive.

Reviews.Title: “Not our cup of tea”
Reviews.Author: twogaijins
Reviews.Content: To be fair, the service at the hotel was good for the most part and I accept that the hotel gets many excellent reviews. We were on the 40th floor so had a good view. The room was a good size but it had no tea/coffee making facilities which was disappointing. There was no complimentary water provided - odd for a hotel of this level. Housekeeping seems to be a weak link in the chain. On arriving after a very long flight at around midnight we had no toiletries and so had to wait for them to be brought upstairs before we could shower. The guy who did so then stood as if waiting on a tip. I did have to laugh... We had the "do not disturb" on the door on two occassions but were once called to check if we wanted turndown and once to see if we wanted the room made up - which woke us up! If they can see the DND and don't knock, they shouldn't call either. The cleaning staff would also shout down the halls to each other and once asked me hurriedly which room I was leaving only to then run down the hall towards it. I assume they are on a time budget. The Internet is ok. There is complimentary wifi provided, and higher speed for streaming etc at $10 per day. The bathroom was a little disappointing for a hotel like this. Although large, they haven't used the space well. There's only one sink, and no separate shower - you have to shower over the bath and this leaks all over the bathroom floor. On our last night we got to bed about 12 and had to be up at 5am for our flight. Across the hall someone was having a room party and there was a lot of coming and going. We called security who, instead of asking the extra guests to leave, asked them to "keep the noise down". The party went on all night after this and the hall was littered with food and packaging. I felt like the hotel didn't want to have to deal with a problem guest which meant others had to suffer. All in all, the location is decent and the staff mostly good. But for the price there will be better options. I wouldn't stay here again - I'd probably pay more to go back to the Trump.

Reviews.Title: “Still my favorite”
Reviews.Author: clolm
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons remains my favorite hotel in Chicago. Staff is the best you could ask for. Just the right balance of professional and friendly. Extremely knowledgeable. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons quiet luxury in the big city”
Reviews.Author: WaupacaTraveller
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Chicago continues to offer luxury right on Michigan avenue. Recently stayed ina Premier Room which is essentially a small suite with a great lake view. Service was top notch. Pool , gym and spa facilities are well maintained. Lobby is much quieter than its sister property the Ritz Carlton. Room service (breakfast) is always excellent and prompt. There is also a small convenience store in the mall just below the hotel for snacks and drinks if you do not wish to hit the mini bar. Love this place and it continues to deliver a 5 star experience year after year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Again”
Reviews.Author: BbytthDr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons for a second time, recently, and it's still up to par. The room had a terrific view, good service from staff, room service was prompt!

Reviews.Title: “Windy in the Windy City”
Reviews.Author: A_OKD
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons on a recent trip to Chicago. The hotel is conveniently located near the Magnificent Mile and many other attractions (e.g. John Hancock Observatory, the 900 shopping center). The check-in process was flawless and everyone at the hotel was friendly and genuinely interested in making the stay comfortable. Note that the reception of the hotel is located on the 7th floor of the complex. Our room was on the 42 floor and offered a wonderful view of western Chicago. Because we were this high up the wind did create a 'creaking' noise in the room and the hotel recognized this and provided ear plugs for those who may need them for sleeping. I did not need them. I would not hesitate to recommend this Four Seasons to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Windy City Favourite”
Reviews.Author: Peter L
Reviews.Content: Superb service with a smile,Concierge is quite superb.We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “The best experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: Kevin N
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons was amazing in every way. Had a great time, great room and superb staff.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel can't wait to come back.”
Reviews.Author: sheshe0776
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. Staff and service was fantastic. Very clean and we had an amazing suite. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laura B
Reviews.Content: Service wonderful. Lovely, large room with stunning view. Gave me upgrade. Food also excellent - room service & restaurant. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: bscotchnh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights in the Four Seasons at the end of May for our son's wedding in Chicago. From check in (second floor) to check out, we were totally satisfied with the facility and the staff. Our room was well sized and nicely done; definitely up to Four Seasons standards. The concierge staff was most accomodating, arranging for a car rental within walking distance from the hotel, and helping with restaurant and shopping suggestions. We wanted to arrange for a farewell brunch for our wedding guests, and the accommodater was excellent working with us on menu and pricing choices. The Four Seasons location is well placed in the Miracle Mile, and has a shopping mall with direct access from the hotel. The staff was always friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: alli1523
Reviews.Content: Really a wonderful hotel which we got at a great rate for a Four Seasons - under $300 per night- 4 rooms for 3 nights. The rooms are very clean and inviting, nice decor and had fantastic views of the city - really lovely. Good amenities, Modern rooms, beautiful decor, but still some old charm. General hotel area was also wonderful, clean and inviting. Comfortable beds and pillows, rooms always well cleaned. Very friendly, helpful and professional staff. No noise issues. Would return and recommend this hotel. cons: Booked 4 kings for colleagues and myself - the other three were much better laid out, mine had to issues with the placement of the closet in proximity to the bed and walkway to the bathroom. Need more power outlets - could only find 1 which was not in an easily accessible location. Didn't eat in much - breakfast was pricey for nothing too spectacular. Would be nice to have a coffee maker in the room.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: oscarspet
Reviews.Content: The perfect location for a city break. Although busy you never had to wait for service especially at the bar. The service on Sunday, just before brunch started was a bit slow compared to other mornings, but I suppose that is to be expected. My only gripe would be that the King size beds are quite small compared to other American hotels and the duvet did not seem big enough. The lack of a coffee making facility in the room was also a bit of an annoyance for a hotel of such a high standard. Overall this is a first class hotel , with all Chicago has to offer on the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury all the way, Four Seasons, Chicago”
Reviews.Author: RJALSA
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel! Service is exceptional. The front desk staff personally escort guests checking in to the elevator banks; every interaction with staff ends with a question, "can we do anything else to help"; they are unfailingly and genuinely pleasant. Beautiful decor/ modern amenities and every amenity (toilitries plentiful and high quality). I had a lake view suite - a well appointed two rooms with a breathtaking view. Sparkling clean. Beautiful art and furniture (eg oval tall boy dresser with dove tail joints). The beds are heavenly (pillow top/ duvets). The tv's are all flat screen. Free Wifi + wire connect if needed. Upgrades to higher speed are available for $10 which I used one of the days but the basic service was adequate for the usual work related activities (emails/ word documents). Good strong coffee is available at no charge in the lobby 24 hours and there are even small muffins there too in the morning. Great location - a half block to the Magnificient Mile and John Hancock Center. I was at a conference. Good quality pens and paper were available and the meeting rooms and equipemnt worked well. It also was multifunctional serving for presentations and in the evening, a black tie gala with decor to match: hard to believe it was the same space. As nice as the carpeted grand staircase was to the conference level (like stepping on pillows all the way up and down), it was a quite a drawback to have to use the stairs or go to a different elevator bank and not be able to go from room to meeting floor with one elevator. The room elevators stop at that floor but access is limited to the spa and not to the meeting room side. It requires going to the lobby floor, navigating to the staircase, passing by where the elevator bank might be, and then into the meeting room area. I had room service one night. The trolly had a built in warming area for the plate which I thought was neat but the food was disappointing: eg grilled asparagus was 4 shrivelled stalks so maybe the warming did that to them. But, that was minor. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again. I did not hear the creaking from the wind that we were warned about or need to use the distributed ear plugs. It was a pleasure from the moment of check in to departure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in an unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: JMSamuel
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend in Chicago early September, my first time there, and our friends suggested the Four Seasons. While I like nice hotels I generally shy from the large chains in favor of local flavor, I am glad I stayed at the Four Seasons. We got there and for a very nominal amount we were able to upgrade to a junior suite overlooking the lake. The suite, and it is two rooms so I do not know why they refer to it as "junior," was large and beautifully appointed, as are the common areas. The staff was very helpful, all around. From housekeeping, to the front desk to the concierge, there was nothing they would not do to accommodate us; not that we were hard to please. As well, the location is impeccable, less than half a block from the Magnificent Mile, as well as the Oak/State Street shopping area. Our friends had their dog with them and the hotel was more than accommodating. They brought a doggie bed, food and water dishes, food and Voss water, all free of charge. The same Voss water that cost an arm and a leg in the mini bar was free for the dog, go figure. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice”
Reviews.Author: aspokaneman
Reviews.Content: Great location, awkward lobby (you have to take the elevator to get to it!) and generally good service. Proximity to Michigan Avenue and Lake Michigan a big plus. Have stayed here twice---had excellent front desk experience the first time and a rather frustrating experience the second time. Bar in the lobby is a great place to get an appetizer and have a few drinks but can get crowded later in the evening and service and get slow. Overall, a good choice for Chicago accomodations.....

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend at Four Seasons Chicago”
Reviews.Author: MarkSumner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned home from a 4 night stay at the Four Seasons Chicago and, as usual, the Four Seasons delivered. Our room was not ready when we arrived, but we were quickly ushered into the bar for complimentary drinks and appetizers while we waited. Which worked out perfectly, as we were both hungry and enjoyed having a drink. Our delay was no more than 30 minutes. We were in town for our anniversary and the hotel made a surprise delivery of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries on our first night. The timing was perfect, as it was delivered about 45 minutes before we were planning to leave for our dinner reservation, so it made for a nice before dinner drink. The rooms are large and well appointed, the service is exactly what you expect from the Four Seasons (which always seems to exceed my expectations) and the location is perfect, one block off Michigan Ave. Perfect Chicago hotel for any type of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Four Season's”
Reviews.Author: Savvygirl1
Reviews.Content: This Four Seaons does not disappoint.great service, clean, great location. Loved the suites...comfy beds and pillows. We are pretty picky travelers and would definitely stay here again. Great massage in the spa with Anna.

Reviews.Title: “This was our first Four Seasons Hotel experience. Expensive... but a wonderful venue. They DO make you feel special!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne M
Reviews.Content: Again ... this particular Hotel and City of Chicago - very friendly and very clean. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous in every way possible”
Reviews.Author: lisah559
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons after our trip to NYC was derailed by Hurricane Irene. From the moment we arrived, we were made to feel welcome. The staff were friendly and engaging. No snobbishness here! On our last night, we asked about a late checkout and were given until 4pm. That allowed us to explore for the day and freshen up before our flight home. The concierge team were full of great advice and information. Loved the extra discount at Bloomingdales! We look forward to visiting again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great staff, Great service.......congrats....”
Reviews.Author: GeneB211
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful experience, and a great location to the beach..

Reviews.Title: “Average for Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Excaper
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a suite at this hotel for 3 days in early September. We are a mid-forties couple and like to stay in nice hotels but this was an extravagant long weekend for us. We have stayed at several Four Seasons properties before and have always experienced the utmost in service. There is usually no better! This time I think they need a little work - just a little. Make no mistake, this is a beautiful luxury hotel. Unfortunately when your reputation is built on perfection, even slight imperfections are noticed. The location is excellent, right on Michigan Ave, across from the Hancock Tower. Easy to walk almost everywhere. In the room, the bedding was lovely, the view over Lake Michigan was almost worth the price of the room, and at any other hotel the things I will mention would not even be noticed. The bathroom was very nice with the vanity and sink being in one room and the shower, bath and toilet being in another. The bathtub was undermounted and surrounded by marble. It looked very nice but, unfortunately, it would have been difficult to relax as the back of your neck would have been resting again the marble slab which stuck out over the tub by about an inch. The walk-in shower was beautiful with marble tiles and a double shower head. However, it was quite a tight fit and the hand-held shower head barely dribbled. The pressure on the wall-mouted head was excellent and even reducing the pressure there did not improve the hand-held. They did provide a good hairdryer and the vanity was equipped with a lighted magnifying mirror which, for over-forties, is almost a necessity for makeup application! There is a restaurant and a bar on the lobby level. The bar is excellent with attentive staff and comfortable seating but when the hotel is crowded, the bar is usually full to capacity. The restaurant is very attractive but I would call the food only slightly better than mediocre. Wine selection is also only okay with a heavy emphasis on California. The front desk staff gets a 6 out of 5 for service, the room service staff and bar staff get a 5 out of 5, the restaurant staff gets a 4 out of 5, and the concierges get a 3 out of 5, at best. Since we had never been in Chicago before, we had some questions. Basically, all requests for dining suggestions were met with a printed sheet which contained what seemed like half the restaurants in the city. Never even offered to make reservations for us. I forgot to pack some items for which I needed to go to a drugstore. After much discussion amongst three concierges, they directed me to a Walgreens 5 blocks away. While shopping the next day I noticed another Walgreens only 2 blocks away. Other question were answered with printed lists or "I don't know". Definitley not up to Four Seasons standards!! The gym was well equipped with cardio machines but was somewhat lacking for weight-training machines. I was trying to find a machine for lateral pull-downs and asked the attendant. She directed me to a machine for leg work then smiled and walked away. I used an elastic for the laterals. One other thing that may be annoying to some people (wasn't an issue for us) was that the hotel is split into two sections. The lobby is on the 7th or 8th floor and you have to return to the lobby to move between sections. This means two separate elevator banks to get from your room to the ground. Finally there is a high-end mall accessible from the hotel which is anchored by a Bloomingdales. Nice if you were visiting in the winter. All in all, a great hotel, just not up to Four Seasons' standards.

Reviews.Title: “Living off the name”
Reviews.Author: Dingbatcat
Reviews.Content: I remember when FS Chicago was ranked number one; I don't know if it was ever top notch but it is sure a also ran now in Chicago. Little things matter in the top luxury hotel class- Four Seasons Chicago has trouble With the basics like room service, a.m. Newspapers, worn out bed mattress. It may of been just this weekend but I felt there was a endless wedding Going on jamming up the elevators and lobby; this must be the main money making enterprise of the hotel. If you can get a deal it's worth a stay; if you are picky you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Foodie_MM
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Doesn't miss a beat. Every detail is thought of. If you are doing a high end holiday or business trip this hotel is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Small town service in a big city hotel”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustnyc45
Reviews.Content: My mom and I spent a lovely night downtown at the Four Seasons and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff were courteous and helpful. The location was great as was the view from our 46th floor room (all of the rooms are on floors 30 - 46).

Reviews.Title: “What a great time at the Four Seasons Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ilikegooddesign
Reviews.Content: We live in the Chicago area so I don't often stay overnight in the city. We had our daughters wedding in the city last weekend and stayed at the Four Seasons as did many of the guests. While the wedding wasn't at the hotel the location on North Micigan Avenue above the high end 900 mall was perfect and I was very impressed with the wide range of room types as we visted our friends and relatives rooms. Every room was in great condition and one great view after another. Our room had a city view and looked down Michigan Avenue from the 35th floor, our son had a double with a lake view that we saw much of the air show from. As expected the service was very good and I appreciated it was not intrusive but present when we wanted it, I used the workout room and it had everything I needed and didn't neeed to bring anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Shopping Experience”
Reviews.Author: mas10023
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Season's for a wedding during the Air and Water show. Our room had a great view of the planes which was a nice treat. For the discounted room rate we received I thought the room was great and was happy with our view and the space. One little bit of information I wanted to share was to stop by the front desk and ask for a discounted shopping pass. The hotel is attached to a mall which was perfect for our rainy morning. The discounted shopping pass gives you 15% off almost everything at Bloomingdales including jewelry. I was able to pick up a new pair of David Yurman earrings at 15% off. Thanks Four Season's that made my rainy morning so much better!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful..can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Leahg40
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect! Nice view of the beach and Hancock tower. Walking distance to all the shopping and dining you want. Hotel staff were excellent. Spa had great service. We did not eat there but those that did enjoyed the food as well. I'll stay again when we are in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Everything a Four Seasons should NOT be”
Reviews.Author: Ogh Z
Reviews.Content: Visited Chicago with my wife. When making the reservation, we also ordered a limousine transfer to the hotel from the airport. The guy they sent to the airport for "meet and greet" service did not even bother to respond to a "good afternoon" and a smile - absolutely nothing, not even a nod. Just a blank - and very cold - stare. Upon check-in, they told us that their Michelin-starred fine dining restaurant would be open and they even prentended to make a reservation for us. However, just as we were getting ready for the dinner, they phoned our room and told that this was not true, and that we would have to be content with their casual "bistro". In that bistro, things got even worse: they tried to sit us not in the dining room but in a dark bar area with no table clothes at all, or waiters for that matter, etc., and next to a very loud bunch of guys apparently for a night of hearty binge drinking, and only upon request were we moved to a proper dining area(vwhere service was rather erratic). The housekeeping was dismal or, rather, non-existent - no turndown in the second evening of our stay. We were left with dirty towels on bathroom floors and used wine glasses on tables. When leaving the hotel for airport, the doorman was completely unaware of our airport limousine transfer although it was ordered through the concierge, the porter could not first find our luggage etc., and only with some difficulty and a long wait were we able to get the staff to find our luggage and get it into the trunk. All in all, the staff of this particular establishent was very unfriendly and incompetent and made us feel very unwelcome. (And we tipped everyone well until we saw that it was no good). NEVER AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “It wasn't what I expected a Four Seasons to be like...”
Reviews.Author: rachelynG
Reviews.Content: I think I had high expectations from the Four Seasons. I came with my girlfriends and had heard from them regarding how wonderful the one in Hawaii was. This was my first stay here. I usually stay at the Drake. The hotel was in a great location downtown and adjoins the mall and Bloomingdales. I think first impression is key. Upon check-in, our room was not ready. This was near 3pm when check-in should be available. Mind you, we just came from a 5 hour flight from San Francisco and had been up since 3am...all we wanted to do was check-in and rest and freshen up. They told us it would be an hour. We ended up wandering the city until they called us at around 5pm. Because of this, I also lost my Tom Ford sunglasses - but that is another story. We finally check-in, no call to see if we were okay in the room, no appologies for the hurrendous delay, no nothing. The room itself was nice with a view and very comfortable. The spa was nice, but had better massages for less. They had fresh orange juice and coffee. Upon check out - I asked for a late check out. They said no. I asked to talk to a manager and reminded them that we had a long delay checking in and the least they can do is accommodate us for a couple more hours. If I didn't pull this card, I probably wouldn't have gotten this extension. I think I just expected more from this hotel and thought that customer service would be the difference and sadly it just didn't live up. I hope others will have a better experience...

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: AllClear
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business in August. I had expectations of a traditional but upscale hotel. I must say I was impressed. The bellman used my name and was very cheerful and helpful after a long day of flight delayed travel. The front desk greeted me with a smile and by name and also had my reservation on the counter when I walked up. He told me I was upgraded to a lake view which I was very happy about. The room was very clean and spacious. The furnishings were classic and comfortable. Our meeting room was very comfortable. The fitness center was very adequate. The staff throughout the hotel were friendly and helpful. And we were close to restaurants, shopping, and the lake. I would stay there again and look forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: thetravelingfool4537
Reviews.Content: Great location with a fantastic view of the lake from our room. Concierge and staff all extremely friendly and helpful. What you would expect from the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service for a Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: m343
Reviews.Content: Thermostats in both rooms of the suite didn't work--ugly since it is 95 degrees outisde. So not enough A/C. Internet service painful to connect to and hotel doesn't understand how its vendor works. Connected me to a caricature customer service rep in India who didn't speak much English and couldn't help. Crazy that Four Seasons can't deliver AC and working internet at >$400/night.

Reviews.Title: “Anticipated all my needs”
Reviews.Author: L629
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Seasons Chicago recently on business. Had not been to the Hotel since the rooms had been renovated and was really pleased with my room. It was relaxing and simply beautiful. Had a late night arrival and needed clothes pressed for an early meeting and was able to get everything done seemlessly. Even though there were many people in the hotel during my stay, the staff was very attentive and pleasant with me (and it seemed with everyone around me), assisting me with the additional items I needed for my various meetings during my stay. I look forward to my next visit to the Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Top Chicago Location”
Reviews.Author: MikeN_Omaha
Reviews.Content: Great location on the Magnificent Mile. Beautiful lobbies. Time to update the room dÃ©cor.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful with the highest service levels.”
Reviews.Author: DAS-043
Reviews.Content: Up to date contemporary and classic luxury. Will definitely stay again for business and with family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, I would return in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: cindy_corcoran1
Reviews.Content: Thoughly enjoyed ourselves, would recommend to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-service -and pampering in "rooms with a view".”
Reviews.Author: SHGee
Reviews.Content: Have enjoyed many stays in this-our favorite- city located hotel. Note: Overnight parking fees are about $50 /24hrs.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: OregonMomTraveler
Reviews.Content: We have two children, ages 9 and 13, and we had an excellent stay in a 2-bedroom Family Lakeview Suite. Plenty of room for all of us to spread out, and each child (we have a boy and a girl) got their own bed. Nice touches for the kids include doll beds for our daughter's American Girl dolls; daily treat at around 4 pm (chocolate fondue, decorate your own cookies, cookies and milk.) The pool was family-friendly and very nice. The Concierge service is excellent, arranging Architectural Boat tour tickets, and restaurant reservations. Our room was classic and with a drop-dead gorgeous view of the Lake. Room service breakfasts were delicious, and the staff who delivered them very warm and professional. All staff we encountered were at the top of their game. Many "luxury" hotels treat people's dogs better than they treat children, and we were pleased at every step to have a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: toddj66
Reviews.Content: Myself, my wife, and 2 daughters (ages 8 and 11) Just completed a 3-night stay in a deluxe executive suite at the Four Seasons on East Delaware and were completely satisfied. We have stayed here once before, and couldn't pass up the "3rd night free" promotion. The rooms have been remodeled since the last stay and are very tasteful. The lounge and restaurant are beautiful and the pool is the nicest I have been to in the city. The staff is also extraordinary. Overall, this stay reinforces my feeling that you can't beat Four Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely property, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Baymom1
Reviews.Content: Our executive suite was very well-appointed and the view of the lake superb. The staff is very professional and curteous. Our bellman greeted us by name hours after check-in as we were headed out for dinner. Be aware that parking is $48.00 per day!

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure...”
Reviews.Author: HollandMIfamily
Reviews.Content: We step into this hotel and are treated like royalty. I love that they always know your name and are exceedingly polite. This hotel feels like the luxury hotels in Europe and Asia, with un undercurrent of class, style and exceptional customer service. Everything about this hotel is of the finest quality: beds, linens, rooms, facilities, dining. Try the Afternoon High Tea or Sunday brunch, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and modern guest rooms, superb service.”
Reviews.Author: jrm92
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be very polished, clean and child friendly. I would highly recommend this for a refined yet approachable vacation/hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jnp31
Reviews.Content: We were at this Four Seasons with two other families. The facilities were great. Service was very fast for everything. Facility was impeccable. One of the best hotel staffs I've seen. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Girls' Long Weekend”
Reviews.Author: BR35Canuck
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Easter weekend with an old friend. Check in is very personal and private (lobby is located several floors up), check in calls you by name as you come off the elevator. We were upgraded to a large 1 bedroom corner suite, beautiful furnishings and great view. Concierage booked all our restaurants at our request and also picked an Architectural cruise for us (the highlight of the weekend). The service is impeccable at the Four Seasons and the whole trip was a blast. Loved the location (at the northern end of the Magnificent Mile) and access to shopping was so easy. Health club was well maintained, great equipment and beautiful changing rooms complete with robes you can wear back to your room if you desire. We would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: funw3boys
Reviews.Content: This Four Seasons put my faith back in the 4 Seasons. After a disappointing trip to Lanai we had a wonderful time at the Chicago 4 Seasons. The location is perfect, we could walk or take the subway everywhere. The little treats they brought the kids every afternoon was much appreciated and they were very helpful when I forgot my prescription sunglasses at home I was able to go right downstairs and have a pair made in 24 hours! We had a wonderful time traveling with our 3 sons to visit the midwest ballparks and this was a wonderful location and hotel to stay in. Would highly recommend! Oh and the milkshake from room service was REALLY good!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever stayed at, goes over and above.”
Reviews.Author: Kathy60933
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Four Season went over and above. My husband was attending a seminar and left his glasses($600.00) in the taxi. He mention it to the valet. The valet on their own track down the taxi and got the glasses back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: Stephersan
Reviews.Content: Hotel was stunning and rooms were both roomy and bed most comfortable out of many hotels... outstanding room service food and freindly concierge/staff. Great business stay and highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonBurl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May/June with my wife and children. We were all made to feel very welcome. Our suite was larger than expected and the decor much better than the photos on the web site suggest. Service, as always, was excellent - possibly the best I have experienced in the USA or, indeed, anywhere else. If I had to make a criticism it is that some of the public areas are in need of a make over - too dark and rather out of date (not that this spoilt our stay). We also found the in-hotel reservation staff to be somewhat unhelpful as opposed to the group reservation centre where they were very polite and very helpful. The location is also great - close to the shops and the John Hancock Tower. There are restaurants close by and taxis are cheap and plentiful. All in all, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Our "home" in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: LauraBloomington_IN
Reviews.Content: Staff is warm and friendly but provides polished, attentive service beyond reproach. We have been staying here several times a year for many years and we love seeing the same staff there visit after visit. Food is wonderful, and the Conservatory is nice for breakfast and for a late-night drink. In this instance, you really do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “What can one say - it is the Four Seasons after all; Dallas, Houston, Santa Barbara...”
Reviews.Author: 060811d
Reviews.Content: If one is not familiar with the Four Seasons Hotel Chains, then it is the ninth wonder of the world. I have never been disappointed with any of the hotels. In fact, if I have had a difficult time in my life, I know to retreat to the Four Seasons for a respite. Perfection is the level of service from these hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spiraea
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, fantastically friendly and efficient staff. The gym and spa are good and the staff there brilliant. I went on business without my husband, from the UK, and was made to feel welcome and that nothing was too much trouble. A very high quality member of FS.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Four Seasons - Means v. good”
Reviews.Author: frenchandparisian
Reviews.Content: For our short getaway in Chicago, we thought me might try the Peninsula, the Trum or the Four Seasons. In such cases, we always end up in the Four Seasons, and are always gmad we did. This time did not disappoint. Location is very good, atop the 900 mall, across Michigan Ave from the John Hancock, and 2 blocks from Water Tower. Short walk to anything, really, as we did not realize downtown Chicago was rather compact, and nothing beyond really far. This is a bonus if you want to drop back during the day for a short break or to to refresh. We took advantage of the Stay Longer promotion, the best value available here, and booked a Deluxe Four Seasons Executive Suite, which is their basic one, requesting a lake view, and the highest available floor. CHECK-IN was swift. Bell took care of the luggage while I drove my rental car across the street to the Hertz facility. The downstairs lounge is typical FS, just cross it to go to the Lobby on the 7th floor, also typical FS with the usual albeit beautiful flower arrangements. No line at check-in. Attendant took care of us, and accomodated our requests ; indeed, we got a lake view from the 42nd floor. SUITE 4219 was not small. A better job could have been done furnishing the rather large sitting room. Smaller bedroom with KB, and surprisingly compact marble bathroom. The lot recently refurbished in an understated way of grey tones. Not overjoyful. View was awesome. We loved the seating available along all windows. Although I might be sometimes scared of height, I enjoyed spending some time there, and felt perfectly comfortable. Luggage turned up a couple of minutes after we were in the room. They alert a lot about the wind noises. We noticed some squeaking, but honestly it is no big beal, at least to us, even in the small of morning for us jetlagged european. FOOD : the only food we experienced was breakfast. Even by Four Seasons standards, this one is right up there at the top. It is outstanding value for money : coffee + juice + any egg dish + muffin sets you back $29, a bargain in my view. They have specials (recommend the King crab Benedict, although I only understood why they did not write BenedictS when they brought it : there is only one ... !). But eveyday menu is splendid already. I think we got the best smoked salmon and bagel in our entire life : fabulous salmon is one thing, but pretty standard, but caviar cream made a world of a difference. My mouth waters at the thought only. CONCIERGE made good recommendations. HOUSEKEEPING is a bit hit or miss. Some day, they arrange the furniture in a weird way. At turndown, they would not empty the trash cans. Sometime the bath disappears, and comes back the next day. Stationery which we used on day 1 was never replaced. There is lack of consistency, and probably also of supervising here. We are loyal Four Seasons customer. Usually when there is a Four Seasons, this is where we are going to stay. Over the past 12 months, we spent 14 vacation nights in various properties (Los Angeles, Santa Barbara, Scottsdale, Hampshire UK). And this has been going on for years. We love the locations, the style, the service, the designs, the food, the ambience ; all these have a price tag which I am more than willing to pay around the world (Provence, Maldives, NYC, D.C., Singapore, Langkawi, ...), the highest in the industry. We know that we will not be disappointed. And nevertheless, we tend to be : there is no recognition of loyalty, whatsoever. Stinginess ? Probably ... Each time, there is just one set of toiIetries that we have to share between the shower stall and the bath tub. Plenty more come up when we ask for them, but this should not happen, or at least this should be in our profile -which we always use when booking. In Chicago, we never had some welcome fruit, any fresh flowers, not even a bottle of water by the bed any given night. Come on guys, should you take for granted that we stay with you ??? But one thing really goes on my nerves, which we experienced in L.A. and again in Chicago : being offered an upgrade for a fee. The desk attendant made it clear what a bargain $250 were to upgrade to a One-bedroom Suite, saving me $300 or so. First of all, I can book beforehand what I feel like staying in, and they make me feel cheap. Furthermore I am getting sick of the big dollard hunt Four Seasons are now practising. I feel that if there are availabilities, they should comp the loyal customers. Or shut the hell up ! This will not, not yet at least, prevent me from staying at other FS properties. I already have a set of bookings for next summer. But im my opinion, what is obvious company policy should be mellowed towards making the customers valued.
