Which is a concept they were better at some years ago.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong with this one”
Reviews.Author: silverstar2163
Reviews.Content: This Four Seasons really lives up to its name. Everything there made my stay very comfortable and pleasant. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: ashah7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights. The hotel itself is very understated from the outside and in fact is not very noticeable. However the lobby is grand, clean and with high end finishes and furniture. The staff is outstanding including the doormen, conceirge etc. My kids were treated exceptionally well. The pool was fantastic as was the spa which my wife used, the locker rooms and the other public areas. We stayed in a one bedroom suite with a corner view which was amazing. The room was clean, spacious and had extras that you would not find in other hotels. It is a very kid friendly hotel. Each evening they were sent up an edible treat by room service. We also took advantage of the "ice cream Man" (there is a charge) and "story book man". Overall...our stay was very memorable and i would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “let the good times roll”
Reviews.Author: latraub
Reviews.Content: I am a consistent Four Seasons customer and have rarely been let down by the standards that Mr Sharp has so keenly held. This is just one more sublime holiday in a wonderful setting ... that being the Four Seasons Chicago. Everyone was kind and efficient . Furthermore, I never felt like anyone had their hand in my pocket like you feel at other five star hotels. We are planted firmly in the Four Seasons lifestyle . Witness.. we own a timeshare at Aviara and are members of the Sports Club at the Four Seasons, Irving,Texas. Thanks for keeping the quality something that we can depend on throughout the world.

Reviews.Title: “Everything's great about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BaselLawyer
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 3 nights at the Four Seasons and were extremely happy with our stay. We were upgraded to a nice Suite on the 37th floor with a great view of the lake. We loved every aspect: the service, the decor, the food at the bistro, the location, the spa etc. Even though I have elite status at several hotel brands, my wife said "We need to stay more at Four Seasons !"... The bed was a bit too soft for me (I have back problems), but that's about the only negative to report. The squeaking noise is really neglectable on the high floors, especially with the ear plugs. Funny enough we could hear it better in the spa, which is only on the 8th floor.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: travellover1006
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights during springbreak and the staff couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. From the attendants out front, to the front desk and the concierge desk to housekeeping, all were very attentive, as you would expect from this class of hotels. The kids had robes and treats waiting for them everyday upon our return to the room. We had the ice cream man visit one evening too. It was right off of the Magnificent Mile (shopping!!) and across the street from the Hancock building. It was just wonderful and we felt so very spoiled! Will definitely return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “What can you say...it's a Four Seasons!”
Reviews.Author: tootlepops
Reviews.Content: Going to a Four Seasons is like going home. They are always so accomodating and make you feel as if they are happy that you are there. We have stayed at this particular hotel several times. We stay in the one bedroom deluxe. The rooms are always well appointed with beautiful views. This hotel has one of my favorite views looking out towards the lake and Lincoln park with large windows. The room service was very accomodating for food allergies which always makes life easier. I always appreciate how this hotel chain makes young travelers feel welcome with little robes, coloring books and a treat box in which to select a "goodie" from. We were even sent balloons one night with their evening meal. The pool area is beautiful and very serene. Dining here is a pleasure. Season's restaurant has a wonderful dinner as well as brunch. We love this hotel when visiting Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: pavlovsdawg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an amazing location, easy to walk to some of the best parts of the city. Really comfortable bed and very nice bathroom. Views from the room are wonderful. I had a few issues though: *Getting to and from rooms requires two elevator trips. The lobby of the hotel is on the 7th floor of the building. Other hotels with similar set ups (Mandarin in NY) have elevators all the way to the street level. This hotel doesn't. *Cell phone reception is limited in the rooms. I have Verizon and had 1 bar in my room, my friend had AT&T and she also had one bar in her room. When I stayed at the Elysian (two blocks away), I didn't have this problem. *The CD player alarm went off in the middle of the night I hadn't set the alarm. On checkout, I told the receptionist who didn't seem to care too much. Also, it's 2011, not 1999, why do you have a CD player and not an ipod dock?

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Chicago A Great Place to Stay for Families”
Reviews.Author: jdwdst
Reviews.Content: My wife, 8-year old son and I stayed for a week at the Four Seasons in Chicago. We had a fantastic experience. Our room was quite large with a tremendous view. The location of the hotel was smack in the middle of the magnificent mile. The pool and health club were outstanding facilities. The Four Seasons staff provided exceptional service. I can't imagine a better hotel in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “We booked a return trip before we left!”
Reviews.Author: shoprdoc
Reviews.Content: We can't convey how impressed we are with the Four Seasons Chicago. Every interaction with staff, from the doorman, front desk, concierge, restaurant hostess, waiter, etc. was exceptional. Our incredible travel agent, Ivonne Chacon of www.whatahotel.com had helped arrange a wonderful surprise in our room - a beach party complete with palm tree, beach ball and coconut drinks. This made our spring break! I had Ivonne book our return trip before we checked out! We had a fabulous time at this great family-friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Chicago the Perfect Experience”
Reviews.Author: gjborca
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled with the Four Seasons Chicago. This was truly a perfect experience from the minute we stepped out of the car. Our 3 young children were treated like royalty. We had forgotten our stroller. No problem! We were supplied with a loaner stroller. Everyone was very child-friendly. We ate in the lounge outside Seasons several evenings. The food was good and the waiter accommodating. My daughter proclaimed the hot chocolate better than in Paris. The location is perfect for shopping and exploring museums. We have already booked our return stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: PJW22
Reviews.Content: This is a really excellent hotel. The rooms are large, clean and well equipped. The location is central. The food in the restaurant is very good and the bar has a nice warm atmosphere. The staff are friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “a noticeable step down from the peninsula...”
Reviews.Author: andergtr
Reviews.Content: after three nights at the peninsula, i ended up staying another night because the weather was crappy, and i have traveled enough times between NYC and chicago to know that any little hiccup in the weather will affect all flights, especially the last one out. as a result, i decided to stay another night, but this time at the four seasons, as i was able to procure a better rate than the peninsula (the peninsula was cheaper with the third night free option, but another night would have resulted in the full rate). i wish i could say that the four seasons is in the same category, but it isn't. the rooms are smaller (i had an upgraded room at the four seasons, but an entry-level room at the peninsula), though with much better views because of the height of the hotel. i found the service at the peninsula to be exemplary in every way--the four seasons was not nearly as good. as i write this, it's been 30 minutes since waiting for two bottles of water from housekeeping after missing my turndown service (i had the "privacy please" sign outside the door). i would not be surprised if it took another 30 minutes to get the two complimentary bottles of water. good thing i didn't ask for ice, too. the rooms are nice enough here, but after three nights at the peninsula, it was a letdown. the rooms here are smaller, and the bathroom is a little too compact. the toilet is right next to the shower/tub, whereas in the peninsula they are in two separate compartments with their own doors. the design of the shower is not great. the water pressure was much better here than in the peninsula, with much better control over the temperature, but the two doors that kept the water in the shower and off the floor did not serve the purpose well, and you had the floor covered in water. not a big deal, normally, but again, the toilet is right next to the shower, so your feet are covered in cold water as you use the toilet. also, the TV is much smaller, though most channels are in HD and much better quality than the peninsula, where the TV is larger, but many channels are not HD. as another reviewer pointed out, the design of this hotel is such that it sways and creaks when you have a windy night (common in chicago). so as i write this review, the building is creaking, and it's hard to tune out. now, i understand the hotel discloses this on some card or correspondence, but i don't see it in the room, and the idea of earplugs, while nice, doesn't help me because i am afraid i would oversleep as a result of them. the views here are spectacular, though, so that is a plus, and it is still a better hotel than most other places i stayed. as far as five-star properties in chicago, though, the peninsula is still top in my book. the trump is great as far as facilities, but the whole building is non-smoking, so that's a minus for me. the four seasons and peninsula have smoking rooms, which is nice because sometimes all i wanna do is light up a cigar at the end of the day. i know the four seasons takes their work seriously, so i do plan to address this with management.

Reviews.Title: “Great City Break”
Reviews.Author: Poppycat11
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Four Seasons. I thought that our suite was very good value for money and was large enough for our family of four. The hotel placed a small edible treat in our room for the children each day and they were very impressed with this. All the staff were very helpful, especially the concierge staff who had great restaurant recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Most beautiful hotel for a night without heavy wind”
Reviews.Author: threekidsplustwo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons last week for my husband's work conference. I came along for rest and fun. The Four Seasons is absolutely beautiful and from the minute you exit your car you begin to feel you might be being mistaken for royalty or a movie star. The service is the best. I had spa employees mapquesting yoga studios for me when I casually asked if they knew the way. The waitress in the bar was dropping fresh snacks and more water the minute ours began to run low. Every employee was kind and considerate. The lobby and bar are lovely. The room is sparkling clean and crisp. The pool is quiet and tranquil. Fresh squeezed orange juice, newspapers and comfy towels await you. The location is perfect - shopping, dining and the lake right outside the door. However . . . we stayed during a very windy week. The hotel creaks at night with the very strong wind. The hotel provides earplugs and a card explaining the noise, but it did awaken me at night. I think this is not a problem most nights. I found it a little scary and unsettling. That said, the hotel is one of a kind and if you want to experience being a queen for a day, this is the spot for you.

Reviews.Title: “A truly great hotel”
Reviews.Author: merton-101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons as part of my 50th birthday holiday. It wasn't our intention to stay there as I had thought I had booked the Sofitel but had managed to get the dates wrong on the booking (full marks to the Sofitel for refunding my pre-paid room though and organisation a short notice transfer to the Four Seasons). We could not have been happier with everything at the Four Seasons, we did upgrade to a suite but it was well worth it. It truly is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in and without bragging I have stayed in a lot of good hotels around the world. The room was wonderfully quiet and the bed so large and comfortable that both my wife and I had the best nights sleep we have had in any hotel. The staff are outstanding, particularly the front desk, the concierge and bell hop. The only slight niggles I have are that the cocktails were not great, or not as great as the rest of the hotel, but I guess most people can live with that! And that getting a taxi outside can be a slow process (top tip - walk down to east delaware, over Michigan Ave and you will pick up a taxi outside the hotel there much more quickly. Its a 2 minute walk). This is not a criticism of the hotel, just a function of its location. I recommend this hotel strongly to anyone visiting Chicago. We loved Chicago and will be coming back in the summertime, and will definitely be staying at the Four Seasons again.

Reviews.Title: “Woonderful attentive service”
Reviews.Author: LarchmontTraveler
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons Chicago is a "total guest focus" place - amazing consistency of excellent and attentive and friendly service from the entire staff - not a single "dud" in the mix. They must be attracting and training with a lot of discipline, it's really a standout in service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: kjamesonsr
Reviews.Content: Just a spectacular hotel. Stayed over the Thanksgiving holiday. The location is a dream -- right above the 900 North Michigan shops. Across from some delicious restaurants (highly recommend Spiaggia). All around perfect experience.

Reviews.Title: “True sophistication.”
Reviews.Author: KrisBrown2001
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed here after coming to Chicago on business for years. The service and rooms fall in line with true Four Seasons excellence. (try to get a lake view - the sunrise is absolutely gorgeous -- both times, I've had a full wall of windows in the bedroom as well as the desk in the sitting room) The highlight for this trip was the incredible massage I just had to tonight. I had the 80 minute, aromatherapy massage. I can't remember her name, but the therapist went above and beyond and did a bit of reflexology -- targeting my neck, back and even digestive system health! Very pleased and will definately be back. the 80 minute, Aromatherapy massage. The therapist can adjust touch for mild or deep-tissue. My gal also did a bit of reflexology for neck, back and even digestive system health!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PrincessSC
Reviews.Content: We loved the FS Chicago. They upgraded us to a fabulous suite overlooking the lake. The room and location was great. There was construction going on and we never noticed. I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: Champagneandcupcakes
Reviews.Content: I went to meet a friend in Chicago and we stayed here for 3 nights. It was heavenly! Service was great, all requests were delivered promptly and with a smile. The bed and room was comfortable and it's convenient for shopping, especially in the winter when you don't want to go outside. Lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wish we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: rdytotravel6
Reviews.Content: Our corner room was amazing, with 2 bathrooms and a view of the city and also Lake Michigan. We had booked the Executive suite but when we arrived they upgraded us to a King suite (no extra charge) Tthe Housekeeping staff was fantastic always there to meet every need and check-in was fast and friendly. Room service was a little pricey but it is expected at a hotel of that caliber but the food was good. Husband was there on business but I just relaxed for 2 days and wish we could have stayed longer. For those of you who like to shop, level 6 on the elevator takes you to the 900 shops at Bloomingdales. The only thing I would recommend is that if you are there to relax put the Do Not Disturb sign on your door because there is always someone ringing the doorbell wanting to know if you need anything (fresh linens, ice etc.) but once again thats the caliber of that hotel. We really look forward to gong back. Thank you Four Seasons for a Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “good room service food; mediocre spa; limited gym hours”
Reviews.Author: giulietta429
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights on business. pros: - fitness center will give you sneakers if you forget yours (as I did); there is water and towels and a good selection of new machines - nice pool - could be bigger - fruit and drinks available in the sitting room near the pool - very nice looking locker rooms with steam room/sauna (did not get a chance to try) - tasty food - made 'special request' fruit platter for me with papaya and figs - l'occitane amenities in the bathroom (but no cotton swabs / cotton balls) cons: - fitness center not open 24 hours a day (why???) - spa was booked solid on a Friday and I had to have a massage at 8 am; the massage was unremarkable and when it was done (and I was still getting dressed) - the therapist came back in to see why I haven't come out yet - apparently I was not moving fast enough (though I did only take a couple of minutes) - one morning messed up the time of my room service breakfast and delivered it one hour early. When I did not open the door (I had earplugs in), they started calling me. Normally would not have been a big deal, but I had only gotten a couple of hours of sleep that night due to intense work schedule and was looking at another really long day (which I mentioned to them when I placed the order at 3am that same morning), and their early delivery deprived me of one hour of sleep. - the same thing happened on the last day I was there - I wanted to have a massage, but wasn't sure I could wake up early and come by at 8 am. I asked the front desk to leave the spa people a message that I might come by in the morning to see if they could accommodate me. They said they would send an email. Of course the following morning the spa people called me at 7 am to see if I wanted to come in at 8. I should have specifically asked the front desk to instruct them not to call me I guess. The stay was fine - just wish there was more consideration for people's schedule and fewer phone calls.

Reviews.Title: “the four Seasons for all the right reasons”
Reviews.Author: poppyseed15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons over labor day weekend while taking our son to college in Chicago. We finished way ahead of time in moving him in and went to the hotel and they got us in to our room right away. When we arrived I thought thye had given us the wrong suite since it had a beautiful tray of milk and cookies, many games, coloring books and 2 stuffed bears. They said that it was alright, we could stay there. i must say my teenage daughter really enjoyed being treated like a kid again. They even had mini robes for children and lots of realyy neat things for the bath. If anyone has small children this is the place to go! the service was great and staff is very friendly and accomadating. Our view from the 42nd floor was spectacular.I love the Four Seasons

Reviews.Title: “Everything was superb!”
Reviews.Author: WanttoGetoutMore
Reviews.Content: We booked a spa package and ended up being able to get a suite with the savings in the package. Read the rates carefully to get the best deal. I loved the location, the room, the public areas, the staff .... absolutely everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SarahInSoCal
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3-night stay at the Four Seasons Chicago and have nothing but nice things to say. We were in a King Deluxe room (4608) on the 3 for 2 special and were lucky enough to be on the top floor with an amazing view to the north. Contrary to other comments, neither my husband nor I experienced any of the wind noise that other reviewers commented on. To be honest, our view was worth more than a little noise. The room itself was nice enough; we had everything we needed, were not lacking for anything and, most importantly, the bed was quite comfy. I would likely book the next category up next time just to try it. We had breakfast in the lounge on two mornings and thoroughly enjoyed it. We also had a late dinner in the lounge upon arrival and loved the waygu buger and fries. We were lucky enough to get spa appointments (massages for both and a facial for me). All treatments were wonderful. The hotel had nice touches like complimentary coffee/tea in the mornings and iced tea/lemonade in the afternoon. The hotel is in a great location between Rush Street and Michigan Avenue. There are plenty of sights, shops and restaurants all nearby. During our stay we saw the button in the elevator to take you to the floor for â€œshoppingâ€�. We assumed it was your typical small gallery of hotel shops. We were floored when we walked through the doors into a full blown 4-5 floor shopping mall including restaurants. A very nice feature that I didnâ€™t realize the hotel had. (In short, the hotel has direct access to the center called â€œ900 Shopsâ€� on Michigan Avenue.) Unfortunately we were not able to get brunch reservations. I guess we will have to go back to try it. I will admit that I had originally planned to book the Elysian. However, we will definitely be back to the Four Seasons. It definitely won us over!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: midwest213
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I had an Executive Suite on the 43rd floor for a long weekend. The location can't be beat since you are steps away from Michigan Ave. and about a block away from Water Tower Place. Also, the 6th floor of where the Four Seasons is located is in a mall. You don't even need to leave the building to shop. Now for the hotel itself -- The entrance for their Residences and the actual hotel are in the same location. When you enter the building you have to take an elevator ride to the 7th floor to enter the lobby area. Then you have to take a 2nd bank of elevators to get to your room. It's a minor inconvenience but I can see where some people might get frustrated from this. Also, the guests really don't hang out in the lobby area. The room was the right size for us. My daughter is 14 and we like to have our own separate areas. They had a treat for her each night. When we arrived there was a box of popcorn and a coke in ice. The next night they delivered a cupcake and lastly was a marshmellow and chocolate treat. Very nice touch! The view was great but on the first night of our visit it was a bit windy from a cold front moving and it seemed as if the building was rocking and rolling all night. They have a card in the room letting you know that the building is supposed to sway and there may be some noises. We were awakened several times that first night but the rest of the visit was quiet. The room wasn't overly luxurious but was quite comfortable. The bathroom was a bit on the small side but everything was clean. The carpet is looking a bit worn though. I don't think there are any hotel rooms in Chicago that you would consider large. The TV was on the fritz during our visit. As we were trying to wind down the night before we left we were getting our belongings together and were trying to watch a program but the sound kept cutting out. Not a huge deal but a little aggrivating. The spa area is really nice if you choose to use it. There is a pool, sauna, steam room, hot tub, workout facilities, and a really nice locker room. We ate at The Bistro restaurant several times while we were there. We had great meals and were not disappointed. Ask for the tween menu if you have kiddos. Very pricey but you're at the Four Seasons so you have to expect it. All of the staff that we encountered tended to our needs and were so friendly. They deserve a round of applause for all of the great work they do. Overall, I would stay here again if I could get a good rate. My husband and I have stayed at the Sofitel before and I might consider that again over the Four Seasons because the Sofitel has a younger vibe than the FS. In closing, you can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Had to move to different hotel; room sounds like creaky boat”
Reviews.Author: CStewy
Reviews.Content: The service at the hotel is impeccable; the lobby and room were luxurious. Unfortunately, neither my husband nor I got any sleep as the hotel creeks all night. They did provide full disclosure that the building sways when it's windy and offered to provide earplugs or other alternatives, but paying this amount of money, I would prefer to be relaxed vs. having to drown out noises. Very disappointing, but management was very courteous to us in trying to resolve.

Reviews.Title: “Close to shopping, beautiful views, disappointing breakfast & beds”
Reviews.Author: ChiquiMonster
Reviews.Content: We got a 3 nights for the price of 2 promotion on a King Executive room and I felt that $1200 for 3 nights was fair enough considering the room quality. I had pretty high expectations since we'd stayed in 2 other Four Seasons properties and been very impressed, but this was was my least favorite of the 3 so far. The decor was nice and the room was quite large, the views were right out over the lake and toward the hancock tower, the service was excellent (the concierge got us a reservation at Alinea on 2 weeks notice no problem), and the shopping was all right within walking distance. What we weren't happy with was that the beds were so overstuffed that it was like sleeping in a hammock - even after I had all the feathers removed my allergies were still haywire from so many feathers and my neck in a total kink. Also, the shower was super tiny and badly designed considering the ample size of the room. Additionally, we thought the breakfast was mediocre at best, really expensive and the waiters were totally unattentive which is not normal at a Four Seasons. We ended up eating breakfast at a restaurant in the 900 N. Mich. mall 2 mornings (just an elevator ride away) and it was far better and 1/3 of the price. That being said, the sunday brunch (as opposed to just regular breakfust) at hotel is amazing (we'd been there before on other Chicago trips and really enjoyed it).

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel - time for a refresh”
Reviews.Author: Sebjames
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel 12 years ago and it was faultless. more than a decade later it could do with a refresh. lobby and room furnishings are a little 90s and jaded though very well maintained. people and service are uniformly excellent. only real niggle is that the rooms are very creaky as the wind blows the building which makes sleep trickier - they provide earplugs with a note explaining this. Restaurant, too could do with a make-opver as it now feels a bit dark and soulless rather than the luxurious it felt back then. it is surprising how much tastes change over 15 years but there is no doubt that it would be chicago's top spot again if it spent a bit of money on a refit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, room a little small”
Reviews.Author: over70_8
Reviews.Content: Service, quality and amenities are uniformly excellent at Four Seasons Hotels and the Chicago property was no exception. We had a room on a high floor with a view of the lake and some of Chicago's best architecture. Service, especially the concierges, was ll we could have asked for. The room was lovely but somewhat small for the price we paid--not even room for an armchair--but the bathroom was beautifully appointed and well supplied. Taking advantage of a "stay two nights, get the third night free" deal made a six day stay a very good bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: saksak
Reviews.Content: We (Wife & 9-year old daughter) had an EXTREMELY wonderful stay at FS in early August. For starters, my initial concern, based on past reviews, was that it might be a little "stuffy" when it came to dress code, etc. This couldn't be further from the truth. You can wear anything from jeans to a suit and blend in. Regardless of where we stay, we never dress up - jeans all the way. We stayed in a one bedroom suite w/lake and city view. It had two bathrooms which is a plus. I suppose the message I would like to send to anyone considering a stay there is that it's very luxurious and comfortable in EVERY way. If you're going to run around the city every waking moment, FS might not be your best option from a cost perspective. Last thoughts: *great location to include easy access to shopping if you need anything, *room service is good but overpriced - not excellent - if you want to trim the budget a little, do so in this area and eat out - sorry FS, *pool is great, *staff was kind and accommodating at all times. BOTTOM LINE: We needed a break from work and to spend time as a family. Thank you FS for accommodating our MOST WONDERFUL getaway. WE LOVED IT !

Reviews.Title: “Non-Pretentious Luxury Where Kids Get The Royal Treatment”
Reviews.Author: Annagins
Reviews.Content: It had been years since Iâ€™d stayed at a Four Seasons, but this summer I wanted to treat the family to a higher caliber of service and accommodations on our yearly trip to Chicago. Having lived in Chicago, I knew Four Seasons was one of the top spots in terms of location. Itâ€™s high over a luxe mall, across the street from a second mall (Water Tower Place) and steps from the beach, Borders Bookstore and American Girl. Itâ€™s also close to some pretty great restaurants, including Spiaggia and Gibsonâ€™s. The rooms are elegant, but not over-the-top in terms of style or design and the central focus is the amazing view out the window. The bathrooms are quite stylish, though and I did like the Occitane soap. The beds were extremely comfortable. In fact, I donâ€™t think Iâ€™ve ever slept in a better one. Amenities are fine. The pool is area is clean and fairly large and there were always one or two other families swimming. The lobby area was nice too. I noticed some other reviews noted how small it was and I donâ€™t quite get that. While the check-in area is tiny, thereâ€™s a huge lobby off to the side with plenty of couches for waiting, gathering, talking or working quietly on a lap top. It wasnâ€™t a â€œsceneâ€� to be sure, but thatâ€™s what I liked about it. Staff were excellent, concierge knew everything and was easy to access (we never had to wait in line) and room service was friendly and quick. We only ordered breakfast since it is quite expensive, but based on how good it was Iâ€™d probably budget for room service and do it again! Still, I did miss having a coffee pot in the room. As for how The Four Seasons treats kids, Iâ€™m quite sure my almost-9 year old daughter wouldnâ€™t want to stay anywhere else after this visit. Not only did they greet her by name, every time we returned to our room theyâ€™d left her a little treat â€“ a toy, some sweets, popcorn, special bath items, and near the end of our stay they left her a dessert from the restaurant with a Happy Birthday greeting. She appreciated it so much. When we arrived back home, she said she was a little disappointed there werenâ€™t any surprised waiting for her. So all in all, this was an amazing hotel. I didnâ€™t use the spa services because thatâ€™s not my thing, but Iâ€™m quite sure theyâ€™d be fabulous yet non-pretentious.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Return”
Reviews.Author: EmilyWaugh
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel right in the middle of everything in downtown Chicago. The rooms are very nice and quiet, great beds, luxurious bathrooms and outstanding service. The breakfast in the pleasant restaurant was very good with the best egg white omelette we have ever had. We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge Masters in a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Antonda
Reviews.Content: No location in Chicago is any better. Rooms are very nice, could be 15% glitzier, like with a bigger big screen TV, but hey, when the rooms start at the 30th floor and Michigan Ave is at your doorstep why nit pick. They simply get just about everything perfect. The views are spectacular. The service just can't get any better. We threw question after question, reservation requests for dinner, transportation, emergency medical care, you name it, at the concierge staff. They were available, and so responsive that it made the execution of a multi family, multi generational vacation work. Nowhere has a better concierge staff. Period the end. They will save your life or make your day and act as if it is nothing with a genuinely eager "Is there anything else I can help with" attitude. As with many hotels this hotel has the annoying vending machines in the room that masquerade as a refrigerator. Move something and it appears on your bill. Naturally they very happily and professionally remove it at check out but it creates "cognitive dissonance." It is, in a way, an unfriendly machine, Something akin to a panhandler at an intersection with a long red light. Not really there to serve you with whatever you wish to keep cold but to ask for money should you make a false move and disturb its contents. The MBA that dreamed up this "efficiency" may have gotten in on manufacturing equally bogus financial products. All that said, the 5 star quality of the experience at this hotel is very consistent and better than other venues of similar rating. Stay there if you can.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful time in chicago”
Reviews.Author: pennyfromindy
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago to celebrate a birthday and see the play "Billy Elliot" . The four seasons is amazing. Every detail is take care of from umbrellas and robes in your closet to an amazing spa and fitness center. PS the shower was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot go wrong”
Reviews.Author: Leatherman
Reviews.Content: When you first get off the elevator (lobby is on 7th floor) and enter the lobby you just know you are someplace special. We have been here many times, mostly for the Sunday brunch or the restaurant. This time we had two rooms and stayed three nights. It really is a special place. The floor help are simply fantastic, the desk people are good and the concierge desk is very good. The bar staff is uneven; wide smiles and great attitude from some, frowns from others. As others have said the location is wonderful. We had views of the small Oak Street beach and the lake and it was terrific to watch. For shoppers the hotel elevator stops at the adjacent mall. What else could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Now THIS is a Four Seasons Five Star Property!”
Reviews.Author: wegoaroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: Great location - close to shopping (on top of Bloomingdale's) but also easy to get around for business. I stayed in a corner room on the 45th floor which had amazing views. The beds and pillows were super soft and comfortable. Service at front desk and concierge was attentive. Fitness room is small but there's a nice pool as well. Free wireless internet in the room was easy to access. There was a noise issue with the air conditioning in the bedroom - the electrician came right away but it wasn't very warm outside so I was fine with just having the air from the living room and turning off the air in the bedroom. Easy check-in and check-out. A happy trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Chicago...my opinion!”
Reviews.Author: armelia07
Reviews.Content: Great service....Great View of Lake Michigan! Close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: view2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a gorgeous FS Executive Suite, which was newly renovated and very sophisticated. Fantastic sunrise views over a frozen Lake Michigan and the sun came blazing through the windows at 7Am. (weâ€™d left the curtains open). Very elegant dÃ©cor in the suite, there is a living room including a chair, sofa and large desk. Flatscreen TVâ€™s in both livingroom and bedroom, but only 32â€�. The bedroom is seperated from livingroom by tinted glass sliding doors. There is a wardrobe and a large marble bathroom with both shower and tub. Amenities in bathroom are Lâ€™Occitane and very nice. There was Voss water and fruit and chocolates in our room on arrival. Service was very polished, and we had breakfast in the hotel every morning. I would not have eaten there if it wasnâ€™t included, due to the overly expensive prices for breakfast items. We had room service one night and had some great burgers and fries in-room. We also had Champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries another night upon returning from dinner, but the service people forgot the rose petals Iâ€™d also ordered. This was mentioned and apologized for at check-out. We had one lunch in the hotel, and quality was very good. Food and beverage is top notch in this hotel. Surroundings are very plush in the common areas, and a great refuge from the cold of Chicago winter. Attentive and knowledgeable staff all round, especially the Concierge. Spa service was very nice and somewhat expensive. Would definitely go back if I could get the same 3 for 2 deal on a extended weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ExpectGreat
Reviews.Content: For business travel, my favorite Chicago hotel. I've stayed many times the past several years, and always the service is excellent, easy check-in, providing whatever is needed when needed, anticipating needs, and easy check-out. Probably the best service of any Four Seasons Hotel in the U.S.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great choice”
Reviews.Author: acdhuber
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Four Seasons for an in-town staycation. As always, the overall hotel experience was excellent. However, we had issues with the plumbing in our room, and there were water issues at the spa, as well. That said, the hotel was very accomodating through the challenges, and it was very relaxing to wake up to the gorgeous lake view every morning. The bar and food services were also very excellent, and the fitness room is among the better ones at any hotel. The Four Seasons is always a great choice for a luxurious indulgence.

Reviews.Title: “Always look forward to it”
Reviews.Author: sdr026
Reviews.Content: Travel to Chicago frequently and usually stay at the Four Seasons. Good location, very comfortable rooms, excellent fitness center, top rate service...everything you'd expect from the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Four seasons Chicago”
Reviews.Author: SeanB2
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, perfect location, best service we've ever had

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ChristianP4
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, highest Standard, sophisticated, recommendation

Reviews.Title: “Dull and boring. No character or vibe at all. Very generic. Too bad...”
Reviews.Author: aidan60657
Reviews.Content: I stay at a lot of Four Seasons and this was by far the biggest disappointment. Most 5* hotels have a grand lobby, someplace where guests are welcomed and can hang out. But the Chicago Four Seasons doesnâ€™t have that, it has an elevator bank to the main lobby. Once youâ€™re in the main lobby, the ceilings are low, the color scheme is bland, there arenâ€™t any windows to speak of; it feels like an old-fashioned Vegas casino. Not the kind of place you want to spend any time. The room (an executive suite) wasnâ€™t any better, despite a terrific view up Michigan Avenue. Very dull and old-fashioned. I thought that maybe we were in one of the un-renovated rooms, so I asked to be moved, but was told that that was a new-style room. How disappointing!! I suppose that the hotel would have been fine for a business manâ€¦ but I certainly wouldnâ€™t bother justifying the Chicago Four Seasons to my finance department; better off at a Hilton for all the generic BLAH of the place. It was a sad and depressing place to be. Stayed for a week and regretted it every day. Big waste of money for what should have been a special part of our trip. Iâ€™ll never ever stay here again. Iâ€™ve seen what Four Seasons can do at their properties in Istanbul, Budapest, New York, London and, of course, the George V. But this was not up to snuff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: kellykj
Reviews.Content: Wonderful time at the Four Seasons Chicago! I traveled with my husband and my 5 yr old and 3 yr old and it was great! The staff was extremly helpful and wonderful with the kids. The pool was a huge hit as was the "toy drawer" at the concierge station and the cookies and milk were the icing on our great trip! Stayed in an executive suite and plenty of room for the 4 of us! great location with so many options- can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest location and gym - good bar.”
Reviews.Author: ibelvis
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite hotels in my travels. The gym is the best for downtown Chicago - the view, ipod/ headset, lemon water... Has enough free weights - bench, dumbells... to give a good workout for the strongest of gym rats. There is a great breakfast restaurant in the 900 shops that you can get to from the hotel elevators. Forget the name, but it is great food, great service and you get a morning view of Michigan ave. The staff is fantastic - a constant stream of "how can I help you?" Bartenders are very experienced, drinks are great, only drawback IMO is the bar has no view.

Reviews.Title: “heavenly”
Reviews.Author: lisathew8lifter
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the FS last weekend with a girlfriend for a girls get-away. our goal was to have a posh weekend and we met that goal for sure. i have been to chicago many times but have never stayed at the FS. for anyone who is going to chicago in the winter and plans on shopping, THIS is the place to stay. no jackets, no slushy boots, just walking around shop to shop. so for convenience, this place is the best. as far as service, i cannot say enough about the FS! we had several requests, all of which were met with accomodation within about 10 minutes. unreal. if the price is all about service, at least you know you're getting what you pay for. we asked for late check out (3 pm), a refrigerator in our room, a spare comforter, or help with the wireless - and we got it. i would go back in an instant...especially if i was NOT paying for it! :) it is $$$spendy!

Reviews.Title: “Holidays at the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: alwaysevol000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Four Seasons Chicago for one night in December. It was a very nice stay. The hotel was extremely busy at the time and I think it affected the staff. Some of the little things suffered. The front desk didn't give us the correct room key, the complimentary hot chocolate and cookies was empty when we checked in, they tried to triple charge us on valet parking (3 nights when we only stayed for one night). Really not a big deal, but I think it was just due to the hotel being packed. We didn't get a chance to use the spa and pool, but I'm sure it would have been chaos. Not as nice as our first stay, but still great service and highly recommended for a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay-cation!”
Reviews.Author: Shafco2
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the other Chicago luxury hotels, I find the Four Season truly the best experience (especially for a local get-away). Excellent service, great bar for listening to jazz and tasting scotch. My favorite in the city. Though pricey (given the current economy); it is a worthwhile indulgence.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury ~ Fabulous View ~ Top Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: lovelifelovetravel
Reviews.Content: The Chicago Four Seasons is above the 900 Shops along Michigan Avenue and is a great place to stay! We splurged and booked a Deluxe Suite on the 38th floor. The highlight of the rooms was the window seat nook that ran along the length of the lakeside view of the room. Nice cushiions and pillows made this a great place to curl up with the paper/book & coffee/wine. Although my kids enjoyed lining up their Star Wars figures for the ultimate galactic showdown. Spacious two room suite with a comfortable FEATHER BED on the pull-out sofa (loved by the kids), plenty of floor space, chair, table, desk and HD tv entertainment center. Loved the bed in our bedroom--nice bathroom & shower with a deep tub perfect for a bubble bath soak. I do miss having the convenience of a coffee maker in the room, but the complementary spa/pool area serves bottled water & orange juice throughout the day and coffee in the morning hours. The pool is beautiful, large and welcoming with a great hot tub as well. Pool toys are kept in a large storage bin to be shared. We love the Four Seasons because of the special treatment our kids receive when we are there. Upon check-in, we found a tray of iced cow shaped cookies, milk in an ice bucket, a pitcher of chocolate syrup and a battery powered "moo moo mixer" the kids could use to mix up their chocolate milk. That was in addition to the crayons, coloring book & Sorry board game placed on the desk. The next afternoon we found individually boxed cupcakes for each of them, and the following day glasses filled with gummi bears and a paper drink umbrella. They also love the child size fluffy white robes that are included for their use as well as the kid pack of bath amenities. Bob--part of the bell staff provided excellent service and greeted our children by name each time we saw him over our stay. These things matter and are part of the reason we love the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at four seasons chicago”
Reviews.Author: vicki3
Reviews.Content: We paid to uprade upon arrival to an executive suite and it was sooooo nice, outstanding views!! Service was as expected at FS, GREAT!!! Our room was attended to 2X day and all amentities were refreshed,, love this. The lounge is a nice cozy spot to relax , great selection of cocktails!!! Will return and stay again soon!! The mall is just a few floors down, so convienient, love the Bloomingdales!!! concierage reccomended some great restaurants too!!! We had a really nice couples massage at the spa!!! I liked the pool and hot tub!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great pool and spa”
Reviews.Author: RADuda
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great pool and spa, great service, REALLY great views.

Reviews.Title: “Expected More”
Reviews.Author: josiewales
Reviews.Content: I love nice hotels. I have never stayed at a Four Seasons before and found it very nice but not what I thought it would be. Very clean, well appointed, friendly, helpful but not Fantastic. Now if it was half the normal rate it might be Fantastic. I base alot of my review on price compared to quality. I have stayed at some Fantastic places for little money (I like Chicagos Hotel Burnham better) and I have paid a fortune for incredible places like the Pebble Beach properties (well worth every dime). The location can't be beat. The beds are incredible. Will I stay again; maybe but not likely.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: drumrisk
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the Four Seasons we were met by pleasant and smiling staff - always a good start. We were upgraded to a superior room, a nice surpise, and Laura at the check-in desk could not have been more helpful! A special thanks to Blanca at the concierge desk, whose help went above and beyond my expectations. The room had a vast view of the city and made it easy to plan for whatever weather was coming our way! What can one say about the bed...was easily the most comfortable bed I've been in and the room and amenities were second to none. Attention to detail ranks high in my book, from the earplugs supplied at turn down to the toiletries/accesories provided in the fitness centre. While there were some renovation works going on, they made no impact to our stay - always plenty of hot water, room was quiet, and didn't see any workmen. The location was ideal for shopping and sightseeing and will very much be planning another stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best. A+”
Reviews.Author: VegasPisces
Reviews.Content: To start, I am a frequent traveler and not particularly loyal to any one brand of hotel. I use this site religiously and always try to book the highest rated property that is within my price range. Luckily, for my recent trip to Chicago, I was traveling with a budget that allowed for some costs to be reimbursable within a certain price range, including hotel. This fact allowed me the luxury of staying at the Four Seasons and it was a luxury indeed. As I entered the main lobby (and each subsequent time I traveled through it) I was impressed with the sleek and modern floral displays that I have come to equate with Four Seasons properties. Upon check-in, I was upgraded to a suite on the 36th floor (room 3608), which had breathtaking wrap around views of the city skyline. This was a real treat! When I travel on my own and am lucky enough to be staying at a Four Seasons property, I like to order a cheeseburger off of their room service menu, since they are amazingly delicious, and this time was no exception. The room was spotless and the bed was honestly one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The bathroom was spacious and well stocked, as was the room's closet (there was even a humidifier in there!). My stay lasted a total of 3 nights and each day my room was made up and turned down whilst I away, no hassle. Also, when I requested assistance from the Concierge on accessing my online boarding pass for my flight home, she was happy to print it out for me and happily gave me directions to where I wanted to go, along with a nice small street map. Overall, I had a fantastic stay at this hotel and would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others. I've read some of the other reviews and noticed one about the water being turned off - on Sunday night when I returned to my room around 10pm there was a note under the door informing me that my water would be off the following day from 9am - 4pm, but since my flight home the following morning (Mon) was departing very early, this didn't really impact me. Perhaps my positive feelings about this hotel would be diminished if I were indeed effected, but who is to say. What I do know is that I had a fantastic stay in a lovely property located in a great part of Chicago. The hotel is attached to a mall, which was very convenient when I had to run out and buy a dress last minute - you can always count on Bloomingdales! Also, I would be remiss if I failed to give a proper shout out to the great people at Bobby's Bike Hike Bike Tours! I learned about them here on TA and am very glad that I decided to book a bike tour with them. Randy was an amazing tour guide and their neighborhoods tour showed me sights in Chicago that I have never seen before in a way that allowed me to truly experience the city's beauty. Bottom line - when I think "Four Season" I think luxury and this property lived up to my expectations in every sense of the word.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Four Seasons Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Bosman
Reviews.Content: My son and I were visiting colleges in the area. We arrived at about 10:30am, way early. They took care of our bags and gave us directions to the Cubs' game. During the game called to say the room was ready. When were returned, the bags were in the our comfy room overlooking Lake Michigan. Check out the view of the sunrise from our window. Throughout, the staff and concierge were very helpful with our many questions and requests. Sent up coke and popcorn for my son, too. We felt very comfortable and taken care of in unfamiliar surroundings, which was just what we needed. Gym and pool were terrific, too. Great location between Michigan Ave and the restaurants on Rush Street.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Construction and Water shut-off!!!”
Reviews.Author: blumene
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a wedding with my girlfriend over the weekend. Construction noise every day including Saturday and Sunday. Water was shut off from 10 AM to 5 PM on Monday! Is this a 5 star hotel or class B real estate in NYC? Rooms were also dirty and staff was by far sub par. Overall, skip and go with many other great hotels the city has to offer. The 4S staff and management needs to be taught a lesson ...

Reviews.Title: “A Big Hotel In the Big City”
Reviews.Author: Crash89
Reviews.Content: Entering the Four Seasons' Lobby and taking the elevator up to the check in floor I was enamored and ready for something very special.The look was an opulent, old school marble with modern floral arrangements. Our check in was smooth as we were greeted with refreshments consisting of strawberry lemonade and Earl Grey cookies (later I discovered that theses weren't daily arrangements) We then made our way up to the room some 30 something floors up where we welcomed with a fantastic view of the Park, Lake Michigan and the neighboring John Hancock building. Beside the view however the room lost any such flash; it was very standard without much in the realm of design. Maybe this is what the Four Season's is known for. We settled in and ordered room service which was prompt and very expensive, I'm ashamed to even write the total. The food was very good and I recommend the burger highly. A day or two later we ordered breakfast and were very happy with the results; it's always aces when your eggs arrive hot. I had an asparagus egg white omelet that was delicious. While on the topic of food, the Hotel's restaurant was a pleasant experience as its decor was a time warp back to the late 1800s; dark wood, chandeliers and the like. The food was good and the service was attentive. I found the concierge staff to be very well informed and quick to react to all requests! The spa was well equipped with a wonderful pool, sauna and a steam room that the employees forgot to turn on in the morning which was my only real disappointment during the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful rooms, disappointingly spotty service”
Reviews.Author: mrwatson
Reviews.Content: I love the Four Seasons hotel but the stay here was really disappointing - all because of something that this brand normally does so well - service. On the good points - great location, right off Michigan Ave, near Water Tower place so close to shopping, the lake. Nice rooms - we had a "premier room" that was really more of a suite. On the bad - we had problems with room service multiple times - once the order wasn't complete, twice they ignored the number of people we had and didn't bring enough place settings and were really inconsistent with what was offered - one day, large bowl of berries, the next, small; one day lots of bagels, next day, one. More concerning was the housekeeping. We had one bottle of shampoo when we arrived and one soap. for the sink, the shower and the tub. No washcloths were left and not enough towels. An old cup of coffee was never removed (through both turndown and regular service) and a bottle of champagne sat in a lukewarm bucket of water that was never replenished with ice and that soaked through to the table. May sound picky but really it's bizarre for this brand. It's almost as if they are into severe cost cutting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but I think if I had it to do over again...”
Reviews.Author: BetaD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and the view is amazing. We had a room on the 44th floor that had a view of the lake, again just amazing. It was very clean and well appointed, however, there were a couple of things that were not quite right. First, the wifi access was sub par, it was free which was nice but I would expect a high quality signal and our room I was only able to get 2 bars. The second thing that bothered me was the desk was crammed into the bedroom, we had a beautiful sitting room off the bedroom move the desk, that I way I could get some work done in the AM while my wife sleep. The third was that the lobby was on the 7th floor, that meant one elevator to the lobby then a second elevator to our room. Now I would not have given up the view from our room for a first floor lobby, but in general I really like a large active lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: staceye2003
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Chicago with our 2 yr. old daughter for 5 nights. The hotel's staff was very friendly and completely accomodating in every respect. The concierge gave us appropriate kid friendly suggestions for restaurants and destinations. Housekeeping services were perfect. The restaurant was incredible for brunch and although expensive, it was worth it. The pool was nice, but really cold. The hotel is also located in a great location and near a lot of shopping and restaurants. On the downside, while the hotel itself is beautiful, it could use a bit of updating. We were in a suite so the space was ample and suited our purposes perfectly, however, I do think the room's furnishings also needed a bit of updating. Not the biggest deal, but we found it so annoying that you had to take 2 sets of elevators to get to the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Why Chicago is the Capital of the Midwest”
Reviews.Author: Spy-Guy-Dad
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Chicago at the unfortunate time of the hectic Lollapalooza festival. The Four Seasons was an oasis of calm in the midst of a storm. As with its sister sites, everyone knows your name from the minute you check in. The spa and pool are spacious and relaxed. Close to the Magnificent Mile shopping and walkable to the Lakeshore, it is a fine location in a top notch city.

Reviews.Title: “A great Four Seasons experience”
Reviews.Author: Annie92
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons is our preferred hotel "chain" and this is probably among our favorite locations. It was a last minute decision to stay here, but after a great experience here a few years ago, we decided to stay again when we needed to be in Chicago. Overall, it was a wonderfully, relaxing stay. Between the staff and the accommodations, everything was extremely comfortable. Great service and really comfortable bedding. I would go back to Chicago just to have an excuse to spend a couple of days here again...

Reviews.Title: “A truly great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kjve9876
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Chicago area, it's clean, amazing, well staffed, and the food is great. I would not recommend this hotel to teens or people not willing to dress up, the hotel has a rather high dress code which I'm not a fan of. Over all I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Fault Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: RusNewton
Reviews.Content: It really is hard to fault Four Seasons, in Chicago or anywhere else for that matter. We booked one night here on the way back from a ski trip. We had two adjoining rooms, one for myself & my wife, and one for our two sons (aged 9 & 11). On a previous trip to Four Seasons (in Las Vegas), on arrival the boys had been presented with gifts of cute little soft toys and so they were curious & looking forward to seeing what Chicago hospitality was like! Sure enough, the hospitality starts in the lobby, where there were cookies and hot chocolate for everyone while we checked in. And we we got up to the rooms, there was a game (Kids Pictionary) and more cookies & chocolate milkshake waiting for the boys in their room. The rooms were very nice: great view over the Lake (we were on 41st floor, I think), extremely comfortable bed, big bathroom etc. Breakfast excellent (didn't eat in the hotel for dinner so can't comment). We also made extensive use of the spa facilities - decent pool, although maybe a few degrees colder than I would have liked, plus hot tub, steam room, sauna & massage facilities. For kids there were lots of floats, noodles etc to use in the pool which was nice. Helpful concierge recommended an excellent steak restaurant (Rosebud) nearby for dinner. We had a really great evening and that added to the overall enjoyment of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WaupacaTraveller
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Ritz Carlton across the street for years but this time I was tempted by a stay 2 nights get one free to try the sister property. The greeting at the front desk was by a dour young lady who had the warmth and friendliness of a government bureaucrat. I was worried but after the sour taste she inflicted the remainder of my experience was excellent. The rooms are modern and well furnished. HD TV and padded window balconies make this a great place to relax. Pool is very upscale and well maintained. Spa was nice and I had an excellent massage by Paul. Room service was on time, hot, good and of course expensive. hotel bar was very upscale and fun. This hotel is a little quieter than the Ritz. lobby has less traffic and the street is not as busy (900 Michigan Ave mall is quieter than water tower place.) Staff are not as friendly as the Ritz, but certainly they are professional and efficient. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort like you can't imagine!”
Reviews.Author: TravelCuties
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two amazing nights at the Four Seasons Chicago in October 2008. First, the view: We were on the 42nd floor with a view of the lake on one side and the city on the other. The sights were breathtaking and ever-changing. It was a real challenge to pull myself out of the room. Second, the bed: Wow! It must have been the combination of the featherbed and sumptuous linens because I have not been so comfortable or slept so well in a really long time. Leave yourself a few extra minutes before heading out for work or sightseeing to enjoy just laying there and taking in the views. Third, the service: As you can imagine, it was incredible. Everyone was extremely polite and helpful - always going out of their way to make our stay as easy as possible. Other pluses: fantastic spa and pool (you can use the spa sauna, hot tubs, showers, etc. even if you're not getting a treatment that day) and connection to shopping from the 6th floor (Bloomie's at your finger tips for everything you forgot to pack). One downside - I was not crazy about the food and while the oak bar was beautiful, the drinks were pretty pricey compared to the quality. Really, though - who cares? You should be out and about sampling all the great food Chicago has to offer anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Other Hotels Should Take A Leaf Out Of The Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: shmutty
Reviews.Content: Simply amazing. Location's great, service staff fantastic (concierge remembered my name 4 days after speaking with me for less than 2 minutes) and attention to detail cannot be faulted. Not once was I interrupted by chambermaids either to make up the room or for turn down service although I was in the room at irregular times of the day. The Sunday brunch is also fantastic. A little pricey but well worth it. The spread was nothing like I've seen before. Internet connection was free which was very useful. I had a great view of both the Hancock Tower and Lake Michigan. I will definitely go back to the Four Seasons the next time I'm visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chgo919
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review almost a year after the fact, but it seems like yesterday that we stayed there. Wonderful experience for two adults and a "tween." I highly recommend the package that allows you to get the ice cream man to come to your room! My son loved it. We had a room with a view overlooking Michigan Avenue, Oak Street beach and the Hancock. Great for walking to shops and the Hancock to see the Christmas train set up, etc. Seasonal lights along Michigan Avenue were nice to see from our window as well. Pool was a little chilly...but fine once you got in. Hot tub was great. Never really crowded at all (!). Easy access from our room to the pool. I would recommend this for families who want to be close to tourist attractions (including American Girl Place) and nearby shops. We were there right before Christmas and it was delightful.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Wedding Night”
Reviews.Author: JLC84
Reviews.Content: My husband and I received a one-night stay at the Four Seasons Chicago as a wedding gift. We spent the night at the hotel after our wedding and it was absolutely perfect. As soon as we arrived, the bellman took our bags and got them up to our room. We have a flawless check in and check out. We ordered a wonderful breakfast the next morning (a bit pricy, but well worth the splurge!) The room service attendant set up our table next to the window, which overlooked Michigan Ave! The room was spotless, the cleanest hotel I've ever stayed in and by far the most impeccable service I've ever received. A perfect end to our fairy tale wedding - I only wished we could have stayed longer, one night was not enough.

Reviews.Title: “Five Stars All the Way”
Reviews.Author: Gufruf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a weekend at the Four Seasons Chicago (our second this year) and it was everything one could ask for in a hotel. The staff is professional and friendly, almost always addressing us by name. I really can't say enough about them. One concierge, Christian, was especially helpful. When we remarked on the cookies and lemonade that they have at check-in in the afternoon, he offered to get us some, even though it was not yet noon. My husband asked if he could get the recipe because he bakes as a hobby. Sure enough, later that afternoon, the handwritten recipe appeared under our door after a call from Christian. But he didn't stop with this. Later that day, a carafe of lemonade and a dozen cookies were delivered to our room along with a note from Christian. This is what truly sets the Four Seasons apart. I have stayed at the Peninsula, but it just doesn't quite have that extra touch, so I will always return to the Four Seasons. We also treated ourselve to tea in the lounge this time. I would highly recommend that people try this at least once. We added the champagne for an extra special treat. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone for a wonderful stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Weekend”
Reviews.Author: rdlcubs
Reviews.Content: Amazing Room and Staff! Great View! It is perfectly located on Michigan Avenue above the 900 Shops. It is across from the John Hancock Building. My wife and I went to Chicago on a romantic get-away and we could not have chosen a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Generalized decline”
Reviews.Author: Ex-LA
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at this property, on business/pleasure. Deluxe executive suite 44th floor, facing west. Nicely appointed room, typical 4 Seasons decor (getting a little tired, IMHO). The room had a very unpleasant odor- I asked the maid about it; she shrugged her shoulders. The shoulder shrug pretty much sums up the housekeeping services at this property: unbelievably indifferent. The room was hardly cleaned up during our stay: plenty of stuff on the floor, only partial replacement of the towels, complete lack of attention to details. This is not acceptable at these prices (or, historically, in any 4 Seasons property I've ever stayed at). Front desk folks were great, very helpful. Valets were curt and grudgingly helpful. Pool and workout facilities were very nice. Free wireless internet! If I'm going to spend this much money, I am definitely going to stay at the Peninsula down the street, a vastly superior property with a consistently higher level of service. Although I haven't written a review of the Pen (I'll get around to it one of these days), I have stayed there at least six times; it is, IMHO, one of the finest three hotels in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Refined luxury”
Reviews.Author: NYinTransit
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful Memorial Day weekend at the Four Seasons Chicago. The hotel occupies 20 or so floors of a 50-story building at the top of the Magnificent Mile, just 2 blocks west of Lake Shore Drive. The location is very convenient, not only to the typical tourist spots of Michigan Avenue, but also walkable to the less-touristy but more enjoyable neighborhoods of Lincoln Park, Old Town, and Clyburn. The hotel lobby is somewhat stuffy- feels a bit more Boston than Chicago. But the room itself was very comfortably appointed in light earth tones. As expected at the Four Seasons, all the amenities, from the sheets to the bath soaps, were top-of-the-line. We had a wall of windows with an unobstructed view of Lake Michigan. The hotel has a good gym with a pool and steamroom. Only concern with the pool is that it is kept too warm to swim laps, but the fitness center was better than most hotel gyms. We had breakfasts at the on-site restaurant, which was also excellent. Above all, the service was superb. Michelle, the assistant concierge, offered terrific advice and was extremely helpful in securing reservations and planning our itinerary. When I return to Chicago, I will not hesitate to stay at the Four Seasons again.

Reviews.Title: “What more can you expect from a hotel? World class!”
Reviews.Author: robertocusato
Reviews.Content: I've just spent a week-end in Chicago wih my fiancÃ©e, and as it was a special occasion I decided to pamper her (and myself) at the Hotel Four Seasons Chicago. Wow... What else could I say? From the very moment you arrive, you're treated with all the due respect that you would like to receive from a 5 stars hotel. Suitcases were delivered fastly to our lovely, 44th-storey superior room; check-in was nice and pleasant, and here you can really see how they are able to anticipate your needs! The room was awesome (be sure to require a lake view room at the time of booking - you won't regret it!), right in front of the John Hancock Center! The bed was one of the most comfortable I've encountered so far! Every amenity you can desire from a room was there, including L'Occitane bath amenities. Even for being one of the smallest rooms of the hotel, it was very spacious by other hotels' standards! We had the Mother's Day Brunch at the Seasons restaurant. Just one word: lovely! The lady I emailed with in order to reserve the table (Diane Regan) seemed genuinely happy to meet me and she asked me how the journey from Italy had been! Food selection at the Brunch was amazing, probably second only to the one of the Four Seasons Bangkok! I loved the potato salad topped by quail egg! Or the crab legs! Or the awesome ravioli with tomato sauce and pesto! And what about the incredible asian selection? Just YUMMY! As it was a special occasion, I booked a couple massage at the hotel's spa. Well, this spa is celebrated as one of the best in town, and I could see why! Everything was perfect, and the massage was great, very professional! We have been offered champagne at the end of it too. Great! The swimming pool comes with adjacent jacuzzi and it's very classy. There's a steam sauna and a sauna. Yo ucan find every amenity possible in the spa, really, includng a relaxation room with free drinks, fruits and newspapers! I booked a "Just the two of us" package, which came with champagne and chocolate-covered strawberries. Adorable! They were deliverd to our room exactly at the time I had requested to, as well as the bouquet of roses I ordered! And this package came with in-room midwest breakfast too, which was really, truly phenomenal! I could stay here hours explaining how good this hotel was, but I don't want to ruin you the surprise of thi magnificent hotel right on the Magnificent Mile. Surely, one of the very top hotels in Chicago and in the whole USA, a truly 5 stars hotel!

Reviews.Title: “You call that room service?”
Reviews.Author: JP3CHICAGO
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night in May 2008 to celebrate our anniversary. It was great overall if I discounted the negatives associated with our room service experience. Our corner room (18 tier) had a great Michigan avenue (south) view as well as an incredible (western) sunset view. We live in Chicago and could even see our home from this vantage point. Unfortunately room service failed miserably. When we arrived on Saturday we ordered a late afternoon snack. It came up cold and terribly overcooked. Because we were hungry we ate most of it anyway. We forgot to call for cleanup and later headed to dinner and a show. Much to our suprise when we returned to our room the mess was stil there. It was quite clear that we had finished the food. The turn down service had happened but they chose to ignore the mess. Since it was quite late we decided to put the plates and mess in the hallway. I called down and alerted room service about the new hallway mess. They apologised and told me that someone would be dispatched to pick up the remains immediately. When we awoke on Sunday we noticed that our remains had not been picked up. I assumed that the individual who dropped off our breakfast would take care of it. He also chose not to address this mess. It sat there for another hour. It was quite the Holiday Inn look! I had been reminded at check in that we had a $70 food credit for breakfast. We placed our order on Sunday morning. The food was presented right on schedule. They missed one item but we ignored this small issue. This time the food was prepared much better. Parts were cold but overall it was good. They did not presnet a check with the service. When we checked out later that morning the bill included an overage charge of $16. Apparently our light breakfast was $86. That was way overpriced. My belief is that the Four Seasons Chicago is a great porperty. If you have the chance, book the room! The location, views, and people who work there are great. Christian at the Front Desk and the woman with glasses at the Conciegere desk are two that stand out as trememdous ambassadors of the FS Brand. With competition from the Peninsula, Park Hyatt, and Trump, and demand slowing things will have to sharpen slightly to keep the competitive FS advantage. Good travelling!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: cbcito
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend with my mother for free for a work related function. I have nothing but great things to say about it. The hotel and it's entire premises were simply impeccable for the entire stay. The lobby is what you would expect; classic and opulent. The staff were great at check-in. Elevators were fast. We had a superior room facing Lake Michigan on the 33rd floor. We were completely undisturbed the entire stay...rooms were homey and very quiet, I felt very comfortable there. Lighting was superb, bathroom was gorgeous. L'occitane toiletries...love love love! Awesome bedding and turn down service...though the napkin at the foot of the bed was a bit much. I cannot stress enough how fabulous the staff were. Typically I tend to be a low-key traveler and don't bother them, but everyone there was a consummate professional. When we asked about a nearby restaurant, we were immediately reserved a table and transportation arranged; top-notch service from people who know what they are doing. Wireless was fast, free, and worked everywhere it was supposed to. I greatly enjoyed being there and felt perfectly at home. Though the weekend was free; It is certainly worth the price. The level and quality of service is completely up to par.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bruiserjohnson
Reviews.Content: Hotel website offers $150 to $250 credit to room or hotel credit for spa etc. Wonderful hotel. We upgraded to a suite and had a beautiful view of Michigan Ave. The spa type bathroom was unbelievable. Our room had a jet tub and separate shower. The hotel felt very new. Our room had 2 flat screen tvs and dvd player. I had a massage at the hotel spa and it was wonderful as well. We would definately stay here again. The hotel is located inside the 900 shops which has Bloomingdales, Mark Shale, and many other stores. It is a great location right on Michigan Ave. We asked the concierge how we could get impossible tickets to see OPRAH. They made no promises, but that next day my husband and I were at the OPRAH show! What they do is call the Oprah show and ask for tickets. If there are standby tickets available they will put you on a standby waitlist. You have to be on the list, you can't just go to Harpo to possbily get in. There was room on the wait list so we got on the list and there was seat availability and we got in!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in the City”
Reviews.Author: matcol
Reviews.Content: For my first visit to Chicago, I had the great fortune to stay at a truly marvelous hotel. My company was in town for the Kitchen and Bath Show and booked through the convention at a great rate. We also decided to have a reception here for our customers and thus had been in contact with the hotel's catering department. Upon arrival in the pouring rain, umbrellas and smiles greeted us. The hotel is in the perfect shopping area of Michigan avenue in a safe and prime location on top of Bloomingdale's and other stores. The lobby is a short elevator ride up from the street and is the start of the luxury. Marble and crystal are everywhere. At check-in, the desk agent offered us an upgrade to a suite for 30$ more a day. I jumped at the offer and it did not let me down. My room was 4003 on the 40th floor. (btw, even the elevators seem luxurious.) My room was absolutely perfect!! I really can't find a flaw with it. The room consisted of a decent sized living room with desk, sofa, and chair.A large window with windowseat looked out into the fog (As I mentioned, it was raining and nasty outside and the wind was howling.) From what I could see, I could tell that when the rain cleared, my view was going to be fantastic. The adjoining bedroom was large and featured a DIVINE bed and chaise. I was struck by the quality of furnishings and everything looked like it was recently updated. I enjoyed waking up to my own music on the ipod alarm clock that was very easy to set. The dressing area had a bench and mirrors that functioned well for the morning routine. The bathroom was roomy and had marble and good lighting. The L'Occataine products smelled great. The room was perfectly clean!! I use to work in the industry and cleaning perfection is rare if not impossible, but there wasn't the slightest trace of anything amiss in this room. The only thing that I think anyone might complain over is the building noise. Chicago is the windy city and it lived up to it's name that night. As all modern skyscrapers are designed to be flexible in high winds, the Four Seasons has some creaking noises that can be quite noticeable in high winds. It didn't bother me as it reminded me of the rocking of a cruise ship. And the bed kept me cradled and pampered all night long. In the morning, the sun was out and I took in a fantastic view of Lake Michigan and the cityscape including the Hancock Center across the street.
