The rest of the stay was great including our reception which was handled easily by the great staff. I went to the fitness center which was cozy but had everything I needed. This hotel has to be one of the best I have ever stayed with and I will certainly be back, even if the bank balance can't handle it. Four Seasons has a reputation for the best in the world and this hotel is definitely evidence of that.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the four seasons chicago”
Reviews.Author: buccsmf1
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? Everything about the hotel was amazing. From the beautiful rooms to the breathtaking views, our first four seasons experience was fantastic. Having stayed at many other upscale brands before (mandarin oriental, ritz) we decided to try a four seasons for our trip to chicago and we weren't disappointed in any way. The hotel rooms were spacious and very modern. LCD flatscreens were found both the living room and bedroom. The bed was exceptionally comfortable and the large window sill was covered by a cushion that you could relax on with your laptop and enjoy the great views. The staff was equally outstanding. Very polite every time we encountered them and the concierge recommended an outstanding steakhouse (david burkes) that everyone in my family loved. The location was also very nice, sitting right across from the john hancock building on michigan avenue. Curbside at the hotel had lots of heaters that helped tremendously when waiting for a taxi in the 20 degree weather. My first experience with the four seasons chain was outstanding and i've already made plans to stay at the four seasons paris this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: TandJLancashire
Reviews.Content: Hotel exceeded our expectations. We received a warm welcome on arrival, had a superb guest room & enjoyed excellent food & service. Ideally located on the Magnificent Mile, the hotel has superb views over Lake Michigan. A highly recommended place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Four Season with Three stars”
Reviews.Author: Docsknotinn
Reviews.Content: A very nice centally located property. We had a Suite with a really fantastic view of Lake MI. The room had a humidifyer but wasn't working and smelled a bit musty. No in room coffee maker even in a suite! Bathrooms are a bit on the small side for the Four Seasons. Comfy bed. The second day they did not clean our room. My wife called and asked but no one ever showed up. We ate breakfast at Seasons. I ordered corned beef hash which was straight out of a can. Exceedingly expensive even by city standards ($65 for two at breakfast). Lousy coffee. Service was stale with no personality but the dining room is pretty. At check out we had several charges for mini bar items we did not consume. Not a bad stay overall but in this price range there are much better choices. Also on Saturday night they had a wedding reception that was a little out of hand with drinking in the lobby and elevator. Not a dissapointing stay but nothing to ever make me want to return.

Reviews.Title: “Grils Just "Wanna"have Fun!”
Reviews.Author: WEARECANADIAN
Reviews.Content: Myself and 2 girlfriends wanted to indulge in a shopping weekend in Chicago. We are from Canada and decided because of our strong CDN$ that we would do a 3 day weekend of shopping, dining.....and yes, having fun. The 4S for the most part did not disappoint. Check in: On arrival to the hotel, the bellman guided us to the elevator that whisks one up to the hotel lobby which is several floors up. Upon exiting the lift, gracious surroundings await you. Front desk staff was prompt and courteous. We had booked the "Girls Just Want to Have Fun" package for our 3 day stay. Our 1 bedroom suite that we had reserved was not ready.....no problem, we were early and we were hungry. They would contact us when our suite was available. We moved over to the Conservatory where we had a lovely lunch and discussed our upcoming plans. I was contacted by cell that our suite was indeed ready. We went to the front desk and collected our keys and were told that the bellman and our luggage would accompany us to our room. Now here's the glich....Previously,I had phoned and been in direct contact with the hotel regarding the type of suite vs. connecting rooms, etc. that we should secure. Under advisement from hotel reservations (not central ressies) we booked a 1-bedroom suite. Now I am a Type AA traveller that likes to have everything in order. I had preordered a bottle of champagne to be waiting in our suite to kick off our expedition. Imagine my (and my friends) horror when we walked into our suite and I gasped,"Oh my, pink carpet!" Believe me, it got worse. I had specifically asked for a renovated suite and I ended up in a scary, 80's,pink carpetted, stained furniture suite.....at the FOUR SEASONS!! Needless to say, my friends and I wanted to bolt!! Yes, our champagne was waiting, but who felt like indulging?? We apologized to our bellman and told him to take our luggage away, as we would not be staying in this suite. A phone call to the front desk, did NOT deliver, "I am sorry, Dr.XXXX, we will relocate you right away." Rather, the hotel is fully committed, I am not sure what we can do. Our weekend was not starting out the way that we wanted. One hour later, an associate came up from the front desk to show us 2 options. We all wanted a separate bed, so offering us 2 king bedded rooms cancelled the first option. The second option was an executive suite beside (not connecting) to a 2nd room. Okay...this will work. Now, apparently there is an upcharge. I am sure the total look of aghast, prompted them to see what they could do......Thankfully, our rates were left as we were quoted! So, here is the rub. We had just wasted 2 hours of our precious time without husbands and children on room negotiations. NOT the Four Seasons treatment, that I would have expected, but then, Dear Readers, check out my review at the 4S on Lanai (mousey area that prompted inexcusable response from management....I will never ever return there!!!) Okay, so we were checked in. We all took the elevator down to Bloomingdales (which is right below the hotel. Things are looking up :) Suites and Room: Thankfully, freshly decorated and very clean. Linens were lovely. The rooms have a decidely contemporary cool ( i.e. no warmth kind of cool.) Really, absolutely no complaints after our first looksee!! Washrooms were elegant in lovely marble. Robes and slippers and soft jazz greeted us as we were ready to turn in for the evening. Nice. Package: We loved the concierge ladies who assisted with our GJWHF package. Our day at NM with amkeover and personal consultant was fun! We loved our martini man who came one evening to our suite and indulged us with a favourite martini. Nice touch! Location: The hotel commands a great location on Michigan Avenue. We loved that we could shop and bring our treasures back to our suite/room and head back out again. You can't beat Chicago for shopping!! Restaurants/Lounges: Excellant food but sometimes spotty service. Nice music in lounge in the evening. Exercise Facilities: Small, but well appointed and very clean. Managed to get 2 workouts in during our stay. Overall: Would I stay here again? Maybe.... I would certainly check out the rates at the Park Hyatt and compare with 4S. After our rocky start, we did enjoy our stay. Sadly, our first impressions (and my other recent stay in Lanai), will not guarantee that I am a forever loyal 4S client. Happy and safe travels......

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: vmuir
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons for a valentine's weekend gift to ourselves. We have stayed at some amazing hotels, but we both agreed this was our best hotel experience yet. The service was impeccable. We were in an executive suite overlooking the lake and it was gorgeous. We did NOT want to leave. In fact, we pretty much stayed in the room the entire time just to soak it all in. We waited longer than average for our car from the valet, which was our only annoyance the entire time. I noted this to the manager and they offered a free facial for a future visit. We can't wait to get back!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Ever at The Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Sungarden
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Chicago for the weekend and stayed at The Four Seasons for our first time. We have been to Chicago dozens of times and stayed at many hotels, but The Four Seasons is the BEST! The service, our suite, and amenities were superb. I won the weekend trip from The City of Chicago Tourism Bureau's online contest and was picked from over 17,000 entries. We were treated like royalty and everything was so perfect! We even had a visit from a champagne butler and got a special card and chocolate truffle cupcake delivered to our room, as it was my birthday. To top everything off, we seen Carson Kressley in the lobby as we were leaving! The weekend was truly a memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “My Fav US Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTravelCoord
Reviews.Content: The Chicago Four Seasons is one my favorite hotels- the service is impeccable from the moment you check in. The rooms are beautiful and perfectly appointed for total relaxation. It is a pleasure to come back to your room and relax after a work day; it's almost better then home (almost!) The best part is turn down service; when yo leave for dinner, housekeeping tidies up, refreshed your towels, lays out your robe, turns on light jazz music, and turns down your bed. I wish everyday could end like that! Room service food is delicious, and the hotel bar has the best collection of Scotches I've ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fluffystella2004
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Seasons Chicago for business. Very comfortable, accomodating staff, great room service, comfortable bed and great view of Michigan Avenue and Lake Michigan. I recommend for weary business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: jdvmd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights while my husband attending a CME course at the Four Seasons. We were offered a special rate because of the course -- Still expensive but very nice. I was very impressed by the professionalism of everyone from the bell captains to front desk to spa personnel. This has to be the cleanest hotel I've seen and I never spotted a maid cart once. When we arrived, we were asked if we wanted an upgrade for an executive suite. We took it as it was a very small amount. The room(s) was huge with a gorgeous view of Lake Michigan and Michigan Avenue (the trees were lit on our second night there before the parade). The location was perfect for shopping and restaurants. We had never stayed at a Four Seasons before but definitely will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great with kids”
Reviews.Author: Bostontravels
Reviews.Content: We just took our kids (6 & 7) to Chicago for the weekend and picked this hotel because its website promoted its family friendliness. The website was accurate. The hotel was very good with children and there were many nice touches the kids noticed and we appreciated. We stayed in a deluxe executive suite with a view of the lake as requested. The suite was nice with a great, comfortable bed, large bath and a comfortable sofa bed for the kids to share. We booked a kids in the city weekend and the add-ons with it were very useful. Kids could order free off the in-room children's menu. We had dinner one night and breakfast both mornings in the room. The price was high (for the 2 adults), but worth it for the quality of the food (excellent) and the convenience of having some casual meals with the kids. Both afternoons when we came back to the room, treats were left for the girls. When we first arrived, there were cookies and chocolate milk, a board game, crayons and an activity book as well as two kid-sized robes. My kids loved those robes! Also, the hotel arranged a trip from the ice cream man. He arrived at our door with a full cart decked out with ice cream and a dozen topping choices. I'd like to say the museums will be the strongest memory my kids will have of this trip, but in actuality, they'll remember the ice cream man for much longer. The package also had special discounts at local retailers (we only took advantage of the American Girl Place special - a free piece of doll's clothing) and free admission for one child to many local museums (we used several of these and saved over $50). The prices at the Four Seasons are high so we appreciated the little extras that were so thoughtfully included in their rates. Three other notes: 1) The location was excellent right in the midst of the Michigan shopping extravaganza. 2) The pool is another highlight for kids (the adults liked it too). So many city hotels either skip pools entirely, put them in the unattractive, airless sub-basement or link up to a sports club where only lap swimming adults are welcome. The Four Seasons has a lovely, spacious pool on the 8th floor with lots of natural light and a big hot tub. 3) The concierge was extremely helpful, getting us several last minute reservations. All in all, top-notch facility, staff and location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lucida509
Reviews.Content: We recently spent the weekend at the Chicago Four Seasons and everything about our stay was superb! The staff is very friendly and helpful. We stayed in one of the suites and it was wonderful. The bed was extremely comfortable. The suite was spacious and very clean. The turn down service was even top of the line. The location of the hotel is excellent and within walking distance of restaurants and lots of shopping. We had drinks in the restaurant and enjoyed the very talented pianist as we relaxed. This is a very classy, quality hotel. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons - The Best Hotel I have stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: MT43
Reviews.Content: I have just returned home from staying in the Four Seasons Hotel in Chicago. My boyfriend and I decided to take a weekend break away. Our expectations were high given the other reviews we had read and the fact that it is a five star hotel and we certainly weren't dissappointed. We booked a superior room and when we arrived we were asked if would like to upgrade to an executive suit at a reduced rate. Tempted by the offer we did just that. The room was lovely and we were very glad that we took the offer to upgrade. The room was was divided into two areas seprated by double doors. There was a lounge area with a sofa and comfy chair and office area in the corner. The bedroom was nicely done and the linen felt so soft on the skin. Each room had a plasma T.V. screen. The bathroom was a decent size with a separate bath (with enough room for two!) and shower area, with a power shower, of course. I suppose all of the above are to be expected from a top hotel, however, I think that what really makes this place great, in my mind, is the service. I am a particularly fussy eater and everytime I called room service to order something that wasn't exactly the on the menu they were extemely accomadating. The staff seemed gueninelly friendly and I got the feeling that they take pride in what they do. I really can't think of anything I can complain about, oh apart from the fact that we paid for the limo service to pick us from the airport and we weren't told that we had to go to a particular meeting place. It meant that we had to wait for about ten mins before someone found us.

Reviews.Title: “Complete luxury and wonderful for families too”
Reviews.Author: BelWH
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Chicago (part business, part leisure) with our 3 yrd old daughter. I spent hours researching hotels - when you have a small child and want a luxury hotel, the options are limited. I chose the Four Seasons because it seemed extremely family friendly, but still had all the luxury qualities that my husband and I have become used to during our travels "pre-child" ! It was an AMAZING experience. We were offered an upgrade on arrival (for a small fee) to a one bedroom suite (we had booked an executive suite), but upon checking the rooms out, our exec suite was beautiful and had a much better view than the 1-bed bigger room so we kept the smaller one (which was far from small I might add, and overlooked Lake Michigan). With a small child there was plenty of room, and each night we had milk/cookies ready for her before bed. The bar area is gorgeous - if you like old fashioned sumptuous surroundings with accompanying pianist then you will love this place. The staff are amazing and remembered what we like to drink and gave our daughter so much attention - her favourite past-time was dancing next to the piano (and she even sat next to the pianist one night!). Pool is gorgeous and the gym is ok - a bit small, but fine for a few work-outs. Location is superb - next to the beach/loads of restaurants/near Lincoln Park and is on Mag Mile next to Macy's and all the designer boutiques. Don't miss out on the Sunday brunch - we forgot and ate breakfast about 1/2 hour too early in the other dining room - the brunch buffet looked fantastic and if you've got kids they have a supervised Harry Potter actitivity which gives parents an hour or so to themselves. Families will not feel out of place here at all. Although not swarming with kids (thankfully!) there is a good mix of families/business people and couples to make you feel comfortable. All in all an amazing hotel for everyone. We've been to some fab hotels (including the Jumeirah/Burj in Dubai) and this is up there with those.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Amazing”
Reviews.Author: aztroon
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at Four Seasons Hotel Chicago, it was amazing. The renovated guest rooms are great. Plasma TV, contemporary decor, great bathrooms and views. The staff is always welcoming and friendly. The meeting space was great as well, had a half day meeting one day and they are on top of service. As normal Four Seasons does an amazing job, and this hotel lives up to the legend.

Reviews.Title: “Very beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: RHimelfarb
Reviews.Content: We booked the Four Seasons in Chicago based on the reputation of the hotel chain. Four Seasons stands for quality and service extraordinaire. We were not disappointed at all. The hotel is beautifully decorated. It is very luxurious with beautiful antique furniture. We stayed for the Canadian long weekend in August and our stay was perfect. We arrived at 9am on Friday morning & had requested an early check-in. Of course, our room was not available. But, they allowed us to change in the spa and safely stored our bags. We gave them our cell number & they called us when the room was ready which was around 2ish. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite on the 32nd floor. It was a newly renovated room with a lovely view of Lake Michigan. We had maid service twice daily and bottled water delivered to our room in the afternoon. The hotel lobby is on the 7th floor. In the lobby they served coffee in the morning and ice cold fresh squeezed lemonade in the afternoon. Floors 1 thru 6 house Bloomingdale's department store and many other high-end boutique style stores. You are conveniently located at the corner of Michigan Avenue (magnificent mile). The hotel is at the very start of the mile so you can walk up and down both sides of the street and not miss a store. I would highly recommend this hotel. You will not be disappointed if you stay at the Four Seasons in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “OK, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: mktozd
Reviews.Content: Generally, I am a big fan fo Four Seasons properties and while there are no serious issues, there is nothing that special either. Check-in is smooth, efficient and everything that one might expect of the Four Seasons. The desk staff are to be comended for their efficiency as well as their ability to tailor their discussion with guests (eg first time visitor versus business traveler). The lobby is rather unimpressive and could well be a part of a Sheraton or similar mid-line brand. Specifically, the furnishings are mixed and matched and appear to be part of a re-do in process. Floral arrangements are very impressive however. Rooms are fine and the bathrooms very lovely with L'Occitane products. One feature that I really liked in the rooms was the static guard spray. Very nice touch. The bar area is pleasant, and the service nice but really better for a quick business drink rather than anything social. Overall, I would recommend staying at The Peninsula if I wanted a spectacular over the top experieice, with great food spa and service (recently ranked #1 hotel in America by Conde Nast) or Park Hyatt if I wanted excellent service and a good bar.

Reviews.Title: “One night was not enough!”
Reviews.Author: Sinik
Reviews.Content: My experience of this hotel was fantastic. I had a deluxe room, and the room size was above average. Room furnishing and equipment was also very good and up-to-date, with plasma tv, large, modern bathroom, desk, bench seat in window and the most comfortable hotel bed that I have ever slept in! Would have stayed and caught a few more zzz's but for the early morning conference all I had to make. But when I did wake up, what a great view of the lake and the rising sun from the large window of my 45th floor room. Everything about this hotel left me wanting to go back again. Good location for the shops, stunning flower arrangements throughout the reception, and very pleasant staff. I was lucky enough to be travelling on business, but I wouldn't hesitate to stay here out of my own pocket as have stayed in much pricier hotels of an inferior standard. Well done the Four Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! ***** 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: saratoga4
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Four Seasons Hotel in Chicago for an investor conference (that was held in the hotel) in May, and this is clearly a great hotel. This is a "big city" Four Seasons hotel, with an older, more conservative, formal decor, as opposed to the modern look of the Four Seasons in Manhattan. As in most Four Seasons, the service was impeccable, from the doorman, to check-in, to the concierge, to the service in the restaurant. The room was nice and spacious, with a large bathroom, nice robes, and comfortable beds, pillows, and bed linens. There was a very nice spa and fitness center with good cardiovascular equipment and some weight equipment. Food and service in the restaurant (for dinner) was very good. One of the best things about the stay was the price. I felt like I was in a 5 star New York hotel, but prices were about 60% of the prices in New York. I have high standards when in a 5-star hotel, this hotel lived up to all of them.
